story:
Our Story

Sakima Productions is a new nonprofit performing arts educational and training company with a mission to inspire each individual artist to grow to their highest potential by creating programs and events that cater to each performer with a realistic experience of the ever-changing entertainment industry. Our focus is to educate up and coming artist with the knowledge and tools to survive in the industry.

 

This internship program will help further the student’s education and training in the performing arts. It will assist the student in venturing into new realms in which they may not have access to and keeping the students involved and current with the entertainment industry while continuing their studies. Providing one-on-one guidance and creating networking opportunities. Sakima Productions would like to give a positive outlook and personal experience to those that may not have the financial stability to do so. The duration of the internship will commence in January and end in June of the selected school year. Sakima Productions will be selecting no less than 4 students per selected school.

Junior High and High Schools that meet our eligibility are encouraged to apply for our school partnership program that then becomes our internship program. Please click this link for specific student eligibility requirements.

 2011 – Anaheim High, Performing Arts Conservatory. Anaheim, California

 2012 – Anaheim High,  Performing Arts Conservatory. Anaheim, California


The Impact

This program brings hope and the education to students that are less fortunate. We inspire and mentor our interns to help choose the right path after high school by providing support and discipline. This program boosts their self-esteem in all aspects of their lives.

This program will keep the students occupied, off the streets and out of trouble. If this program didn’t exist our interns will not have to tools and education perform after high school and most likely not go to college get a minimum wage job for the rest of their lives.


What We Need & What You Get

This previous year consisted of 10 students, 4 field trips, monthly meetings and discussions. We would like to grow to accept more students this year as well as adding additional field trips, seminars, and performing opportunities.

Last year’s budget of $3,720, was funded from Sakima Productions' President, Kalen Sakima and his mother.

2012 budget goal $16,640:

             Field Trips: $3,000

             Transportation: $800

             Seminars: $1,500

             Dance Workshops: $2,000

             Mentor Fees: $800

             Performance Rehearsals & Costumes: $5,000

             Choreography & Musical Director Fees: $2,000

             End of Program Dinner & Awards: $300

             Program Director Fee: $600

             Indiegogo.com’s 4% Fee: $640

If we surpass our goal then our excess money will go towards the following year’s budget. If we do not make our planned goal, we will have to cut back on all areas of our internship program. Currently we have launched a beta version of our website where we started to accept donations online. We have reached out to local and national companies seeking donations and sponsorships. However, we have only received declined letters. We are looking for other ways, like Indiegogo to help raise money.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us by helping spreading the word to your friends, family, and acquaintances. Like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter, and visit our website for more information about our events and programs.

Sakima Productions currently is working on producing our first event, "Awkward Sunday" which will also launch our second program, “College Assistance Program”. Please visit our website for more information.

story:
‎"There is a garden in every childhood, an enchanted place where the colors are brighter..." - Elizabeth Lawrence

Our Story

Kaleidoscope Learning Center is a dream made real. Owner Sandra Roberts, and partner Kath Cameron, have both been professional educators for years. Now they want to take their love of teaching and create a place built on sustainable, environmentally-sound practices that provides a supportive, nurturing place for children to explore and learn.

Kaleidoscope will provide before and after school care, a small Waldorf-based preschool and a wide variety of enrichment activities for children and adults. Located just feet from Blairstown's popular Footbridge Park and the Paulinskill Valley Trail, children will have ample opportunity to get outside for exploration and play. With a certified K-8 teacher at the helm, parents can feel assured that every child's unique academic needs will be met.


You can teach a student a lesson for a day; but if you can teach him to learn by creating curiosity, he will continue the learning process as long as he lives. ~ Clay P. Bedford

The Impact

Top 10 things Kaleidoscope can offer that other programs don't:
1) An Earth-centered, environmentally-friendly, sustainable perspective.
2) The great outdoors and room to play, everyday.
3) A preschool program with a 5 to 1 student to teacher ratio.
3) After school homework help from a certified teacher.
4) Enrichment of all kinds -- science, engineering, history, art.
5) Enrichment for grown-ups too!
6) Programs where curiosity, hands-on experience, and imagination are the driving force.
7) Homeschooling-friendly programs and space rental.
8) A learning community where everyone's voice is welcome.
9) An atmosphere of respect, support and personal responsibility.
10) Free organic coffee for our parents (no, seriously).


Man's mind, once stretched by a new idea, never regains its original dimensions. ~ Oliver Wendell Holmes

What We Need & What You Get

We need seed cash to furnish our building, purchase initial technology, and promote our business before the start of school. We are pursuing business loans and supplying up our own funds as well, but we need money immediately to get Kaleidoscope up and running by Labor Day.

We are offering a variety of Perks for those that invest in our dream.


“Imagination is more important than knowledge. For knowledge is limited to all we now know and understand, while imagination embraces the entire world, and all there ever will be to know and understand.” ~ Albert Einstein

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Use the tools below to share this fundraiser with your friends and family.

And if you have a moment, please take our survey and let us know what YOU need from Kaleidoscope!
https://surveymonkey.com/s/kaleidoscopellc

story:
My Story

I'm a Deaf Education major, ASL Interpreting minor at Baylor in Waco, TX. I've been invited to participate in an exclusive two week-long trip to China to work with deaf and hard of hearing children, and I want to document the trip through a sort of visual journal and photolog consisting of my personal writings, drawings, and photos. I'll be going along with a group of Deaf Education, Audiology and Speech Pathology professionals and students to assist China in working with the increasing number of Chinese children that are born or becoming deaf. The current norm is for these children to be pushed aside in society, many orphaned and most kicked out of school because of their disability. The experience will be incredible, mostly because we're not going as tourists - China has requested us. We'll see places that tourists aren't allowed to and never have gone, and I want to capture it all in a journal that will be turned into a book available on Lulu, Amazon CreateSpace, or a similar site. I just need funds to take care of the cost of travel and supplies for the project. 


The Impact

If my travel expenses are funded, I'll be assisting with determining which kids have the residual hearing required for hearing aids and other assistive devices and which should use sign language instead. Those deemed fit for hearing aids will receive one through us. 


What I Need 

I need about $2,200 for travel expenses, plus the cost of supplies. I have a little bit saved up, so I'm keeping my goal at $2,000. Any and all donations will be appreciated! Every dollar over the goal will go to the art supplies needed for the journal - and if it goes far enough over the goal, I'll be buying a new camera to better capture the experience! The product will be available online to purchase [or view for free for campaign funders!]. 

If the project doesn't get funded, whether or not I go this year will depend on help from my family. If the total can't be reached, the money will be held for next year's trip to give me time for more fundraising.


Other Ways You Can Help 

Post a link to my campaign on Facebook and Twitter, email it to your friends, and spread by good old word of mouth (tell that rich aunt you have, then send her a link). ;]

story:
Short Summary

Hello, and welcome to our page! We are the Tongue and Quill Communicators Speech and Debate team and our team has just qualified for the National Competition, in several different categories!!! Now, you may be thinking somewhere along the lines of, "What? This 'team' only has two members!!" If so, we'd like to explain a bit of our history:

Three years ago, our parents decided to start a speech and debate club near our home in N.C. Admittedly, we were bit unsure of what the whole thing would actually look like; A speech team? Run by our parents? Yeesh...But, to our surprise, we found that a lot of people  were really interested in joining! Once we found a facility and got everything up and running, we had a group of about 30 people (including parents) with children ranging in age from just a few months old (yeah, we had a few noisy meetings...) all the way to 17 years old! We had ourselves a team!

Around this same time, our father was retiring from the Air Force after nearly 20 years of service. After retirement, he was offered a job hundreds of miles away in Ohio, and our parents decided to accept. We'd have to leave our club;we were devastated...We moved.

And our team? We brought it with us!                                                                              We now live in Ohio with a team comprised-for now- of just the two of us and our Mom is our Coach. Oh! And Daddy? Well... he's uh, assistant road manager! We have big plans for next Speech season, including; Recruiting more members, entering even MORE speech categories, and maybe even hosting a few Speech camps!

 Going to Nationals for the very first time is a dream come true for us!

Here's the Mission Statement for The National Christian Forensics and Communications Association; our Speech League!

"The National Christian Forensics and Communications Association (NCFCA) believes that formal speech and debate can provide a means for homeschooled students to learn and exercise analytical and oratorical skills, addressing life issues from a biblical worldview in a manner that glorifies God. " http://www.ncfca.org/?i=12690

Wanna learn more about the Speech league? Just click on the link above!


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word: We understand that not everyone can contribute; and if such is the case for you, don't sweat it! You can still help out by sending this link to your friends; or anyone who you think might be willing to donate; make some noise! Thank you so much for your support!

Pray: We know that NOTHING is possible without the help of our God. Please pray that we would have a safe trip to Virginia, and that (at Nationals) the Lord would perform through us so that His message may be heard! Your prayers are appreciated even more than donations!

story:
Short Summary

ISS expedition 30, NASA photo

I need your help to turn my rural community's students onto space and science.  We want to go to space.  That is right, my proposal was selected to participate in the Student Spaceflight Experiments Program.  My students, over 300 in grades 5-12, will design research projects, collaborate with real scientists, and send one project aboard Mission 6 to the International Space Station.  Once aboard the station astronauts will conduct the experiment and return it to earth.  Now this is science in action!

"The Student Space Flight Experiments Program (http://ssep.ncesse.org)  is undertaken by the National Center for Earth and Space Science Education (http://ncesse.org) in partnership with Nanoracks, LLC.

This on-orbit educational research opportunity is enabled through NanoRacks, LLC, which is working in partnership with NASA under a Space Act Agreement as part of the utilization of the International Space Station as a National Laboratory.

- Created to Address U.S. Strategic Need: high caliber STEM education program tuned to next generation national science education standards; designed to be a pedagogical model for inspiring and engaging next generation of American scientists and engineers, in order to address U.S. strategic need in workforce development for the 21st century marketplace. 

- True STEM Education Initiative: real experiment design across all science disciplines (physical, chemical, and biological); seamless fusion with technology, engineering, and mathematics; interdisciplinary with writing, oral communication, and art and design.

- Systemic Initiative: applicable across an entire school district, addressing state and local strategic needs in STEM education, next gen national science standards, and applicable across grades 5-14.

- Community Engagement Model for STEM Education: broader SSEP program designed to engage students across grades K-14, teachers, families, civic and business organizations, and research institutions.

- Track Record: to date, 7 SSEP flight opportunities have been undertaken, engaging 68 communities in the U.S. and Canada, and providing 104,000 grade 5-14 students the ability to participate; gave rise to 28,300 grade 5-14 students fully immersed in microgravity experiment design and proposal writing; 6,435 flight experiment proposals by student teams were received; 81 experiments have flown on Space Shuttles and to ISS, and 15 more experiments are slated to fly in Spring 2014; 

- Authentic Immersion in Scientific Research: SSEP precisely models the breadth and depth of real research by the professional community, including definition of a research program by a research team with PIs, Co-Is and Collaborators; writing proposals against a real proposal guideline with a formal evaluation rubric; a real 2-step proposal review process; formal NASA flight safety review for selected experiments; and a research conference at the Smithsonian's National Air and Space Museum.  

-Deep Investment in Partnership: over 350 Local Partners, including: school districts, private schools, NASA Space Grant lead institutions and other universities, businesses, foundations, private philanthropists, and local research institutions providing science advisors.

-High Profile Program: garnering very significant media coverage at the local, regional, and national level, with launches at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center and SSEP delegations in attendance, and experiments aboard the International Space Station with an astronaut assigned to the payload. 

-High Profile Strategic Partners: NASA, Smithsonian Institution, NanoRacks

-Breaking New Ground in Commercial Space: SSEP is the first pre-college STEM education program that is both a U.S. national initiative and implemented as an on-orbit commercial space venture. 

  • I am a passionate biology lab instructor who loves the natural world.
  • I am the recipient of many state and national awards including the 2013 NSTA SeaWorld Environmental Educator of the Year.  
  • I was an International winner at the International Science and Engineering Fair in high school.
  • I have designed and built an outdoor classroom and garden at my school.

Remember, I need your help to be the first Tennessee school to participate in this amazing opportunity. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need a total of $21,500 to participate.  To date we have raised $12,000 but need $9,500.00 more to reach our goal.  

  • Money needed to pay for a microgravity mini-laboratory and payload fees
  • We are guaranteed to send one team's project that will be selected by researchers to send into space.

The Impact

This project meets new Common Core and Next Generation Science Standards where students learn to design, implement and evaluate experiments.  

- Created to Address U.S. Strategic Need: high caliber STEM education program tuned to next generation national science education standards; designed to be a pedagogical model for inspiring and engaging next generation of American scientists and engineers, in order to address U.S. strategic need in workforce development for the 21st century marketplace. 

- True STEM Education Initiative: real experiment design across all science disciplines (physical, chemical, and biological); seamless fusion with technology, engineering, and mathematics; interdisciplinary with writing, oral communication, and art and design.

- Systemic Initiative: applicable across an entire school district, addressing state and local strategic needs in STEM education, next gen national science standards, and applicable across grades 5-14.

- Community Engagement Model for STEM Education: broader SSEP program designed to engage students across grades K-14, teachers, families, civic and business organizations, and research institutions.

- Track Record: to date, 7 SSEP flight opportunities have been undertaken, engaging 68 communities in the U.S. and Canada, and providing 104,000 grade 5-14 students the ability to participate; gave rise to 28,300 grade 5-14 students fully immersed in microgravity experiment design and proposal writing; 6,435 flight experiment proposals by student teams were received; 81 experiments have flown on Space Shuttles and to ISS, and 15 more experiments are slated to fly in Spring 2014; 

- Authentic Immersion in Scientific Research: SSEP precisely models the breadth and depth of real research by the professional community, including definition of a research program by a research team with PIs, Co-Is and Collaborators; writing proposals against a real proposal guideline with a formal evaluation rubric; a real 2-step proposal review process; formal NASA flight safety review for selected experiments; and a research conference at the Smithsonian's National Air and Space Museum.  

-Deep Investment in Partnership: over 350 Local Partners, including: school districts, private schools, NASA Space Grant lead institutions and other universities, businesses, foundations, private philanthropists, and local research institutions providing science advisors.

-High Profile Program: garnering very significant media coverage at the local, regional, and national level, with launches at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center and SSEP delegations in attendance, and experiments aboard the International Space Station with an astronaut assigned to the payload. 

-High Profile Strategic Partners: NASA, Smithsonian Institution, NanoRacks

-Breaking New Ground in Commercial Space: SSEP is the first pre-college STEM education program that is both a U.S. national initiative and implemented as an on-orbit commercial space venture. 

  • Designing experiments with gravity turned off is exciting!
  • Students follow real-world research processes
  • Students collaborate with scientists

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share and help me turn my students on to science in action!

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • If you want to help more, we are eager to put iPads into their hands. 
  • Challenge based learning requires real-world tools.
  • Students need access to technology that is commonly used in the 21st century, life, and work.
  • This includes computers, rich media creation tools, the internet, and mobile devices for anytime, anywhere access to information, content and communication.

  • - Created to Address U.S. Strategic Need: high caliber STEM education program tuned to next generation national science education standards; designed to be a pedagogical model for inspiring and engaging next generation of American scientists and engineers, in order to address U.S. strategic need in workforce development for the 21st century marketplace. 

    - True STEM Education Initiative: real experiment design across all science disciplines (physical, chemical, and biological); seamless fusion with technology, engineering, and mathematics; interdisciplinary with writing, oral communication, and art and design.

    - Systemic Initiative: applicable across an entire school district, addressing state and local strategic needs in STEM education, next gen national science standards, and applicable across grades 5-14.

    - Community Engagement Model for STEM Education: broader SSEP program designed to engage students across grades K-14, teachers, families, civic and business organizations, and research institutions.

    - Track Record: to date, 7 SSEP flight opportunities have been undertaken, engaging 68 communities in the U.S. and Canada, and providing 104,000 grade 5-14 students the ability to participate; gave rise to 28,300 grade 5-14 students fully immersed in microgravity experiment design and proposal writing; 6,435 flight experiment proposals by student teams were received; 81 experiments have flown on Space Shuttles and to ISS, and 15 more experiments are slated to fly in Spring 2014; 

    - Authentic Immersion in Scientific Research: SSEP precisely models the breadth and depth of real research by the professional community, including definition of a research program by a research team with PIs, Co-Is and Collaborators; writing proposals against a real proposal guideline with a formal evaluation rubric; a real 2-step proposal review process; formal NASA flight safety review for selected experiments; and a research conference at the Smithsonian's National Air and Space Museum.  

    -Deep Investment in Partnership: over 350 Local Partners, including: school districts, private schools, NASA Space Grant lead institutions and other universities, businesses, foundations, private philanthropists, and local research institutions providing science advisors.

    -High Profile Program: garnering very significant media coverage at the local, regional, and national level, with launches at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center and SSEP delegations in attendance, and experiments aboard the International Space Station with an astronaut assigned to the payload. 

    -High Profile Strategic Partners: NASA, Smithsonian Institution, NanoRacks

    -Breaking New Ground in Commercial Space: SSEP is the first pre-college STEM education program that is both a U.S. national initiative and implemented as an on-orbit commercial space venture. 

    If total funds are not acquired the money raised will go toward establishing a portable tablet lab. 


And that’s all there is to it.
story_txt:
Short SummaryISS expedition 30, NASA photoI need your help to turn my rural community's students onto space and science.  We want to go to space.  That is right, my proposal was selected to participate in the Student Spaceflight Experiments Program.  My students, over 300 in grades 5-12, will design research projects, collaborate with real scientists, and send one project aboard Mission 6 to the International Space Station.  Once aboard the station astronauts will conduct the experiment and return it to earth.  Now this is science in action!"The Student Space Flight Experiments Program (http://ssep.ncesse.org)  is undertaken by the National Center for Earth and Space Science Education (http://ncesse.org) in partnership with Nanoracks, LLC.This on-orbit educational research opportunity is enabled through NanoRacks, LLC, which is working in partnership with NASA under a Space Act Agreement as part of the utilization of the International Space Station as a National Laboratory.- Created to Address U.S. Strategic Need: high caliber STEM education program tuned to next generation national science education standards; designed to be a pedagogical model for inspiring and engaging next generation of American scientists and engineers, in order to address U.S. strategic need in workforce development for the 21st century marketplace. - True STEM Education Initiative: real experiment design across all science disciplines (physical, chemical, and biological); seamless fusion with technology, engineering, and mathematics; interdisciplinary with writing, oral communication, and art and design.- Systemic Initiative: applicable across an entire school district, addressing state and local strategic needs in STEM education, next gen national science standards, and applicable across grades 5-14.- Community Engagement Model for STEM Education: broader SSEP program designed to engage students across grades K-14, teachers, families, civic and business organizations, and research institutions.- Track Record: to date, 7 SSEP flight opportunities have been undertaken, engaging 68 communities in the U.S. and Canada, and providing 104,000 grade 5-14 students the ability to participate; gave rise to 28,300 grade 5-14 students fully immersed in microgravity experiment design and proposal writing; 6,435 flight experiment proposals by student teams were received; 81 experiments have flown on Space Shuttles and to ISS, and 15 more experiments are slated to fly in Spring 2014; - Authentic Immersion in Scientific Research: SSEP precisely models the breadth and depth of real research by the professional community, including definition of a research program by a research team with PIs, Co-Is and Collaborators; writing proposals against a real proposal guideline with a formal evaluation rubric; a real 2-step proposal review process; formal NASA flight safety review for selected experiments; and a research conference at the Smithsonian's National Air and Space Museum.  -Deep Investment in Partnership: over 350 Local Partners, including: school districts, private schools, NASA Space Grant lead institutions and other universities, businesses, foundations, private philanthropists, and local research institutions providing science advisors.-High Profile Program: garnering very significant media coverage at the local, regional, and national level, with launches at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center and SSEP delegations in attendance, and experiments aboard the International Space Station with an astronaut assigned to the payload. -High Profile Strategic Partners: NASA, Smithsonian Institution, NanoRacks-Breaking New Ground in Commercial Space: SSEP is the first pre-college STEM education program that is both a U.S. national initiative and implemented as an on-orbit commercial space venture. 
I am a passionate biology lab instructor who loves the natural world.
I am the recipient of many state and national awards including the 2013 NSTA SeaWorld Environmental Educator of the Year.  
I was an International winner at the International Science and Engineering Fair in high school.
I have designed and built an outdoor classroom and garden at my school.
Remember, I need your help to be the first Tennessee school to participate in this amazing opportunity. What We Need & What You GetWe need a total of $21,500 to participate.  To date we have raised $12,000 but need $9,500.00 more to reach our goal.  
Money needed to pay for a microgravity mini-laboratory and payload fees
We are guaranteed to send one team's project that will be selected by researchers to send into space.
The ImpactThis project meets new Common Core and Next Generation Science Standards where students learn to design, implement and evaluate experiments.  - Created to Address U.S. Strategic Need: high caliber STEM education program tuned to next generation national science education standards; designed to be a pedagogical model for inspiring and engaging next generation of American scientists and engineers, in order to address U.S. strategic need in workforce development for the 21st century marketplace. - True STEM Education Initiative: real experiment design across all science disciplines (physical, chemical, and biological); seamless fusion with technology, engineering, and mathematics; interdisciplinary with writing, oral communication, and art and design.- Systemic Initiative: applicable across an entire school district, addressing state and local strategic needs in STEM education, next gen national science standards, and applicable across grades 5-14.- Community Engagement Model for STEM Education: broader SSEP program designed to engage students across grades K-14, teachers, families, civic and business organizations, and research institutions.- Track Record: to date, 7 SSEP flight opportunities have been undertaken, engaging 68 communities in the U.S. and Canada, and providing 104,000 grade 5-14 students the ability to participate; gave rise to 28,300 grade 5-14 students fully immersed in microgravity experiment design and proposal writing; 6,435 flight experiment proposals by student teams were received; 81 experiments have flown on Space Shuttles and to ISS, and 15 more experiments are slated to fly in Spring 2014; - Authentic Immersion in Scientific Research: SSEP precisely models the breadth and depth of real research by the professional community, including definition of a research program by a research team with PIs, Co-Is and Collaborators; writing proposals against a real proposal guideline with a formal evaluation rubric; a real 2-step proposal review process; formal NASA flight safety review for selected experiments; and a research conference at the Smithsonian's National Air and Space Museum.  -Deep Investment in Partnership: over 350 Local Partners, including: school districts, private schools, NASA Space Grant lead institutions and other universities, businesses, foundations, private philanthropists, and local research institutions providing science advisors.-High Profile Program: garnering very significant media coverage at the local, regional, and national level, with launches at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center and SSEP delegations in attendance, and experiments aboard the International Space Station with an astronaut assigned to the payload. -High Profile Strategic Partners: NASA, Smithsonian Institution, NanoRacks-Breaking New Ground in Commercial Space: SSEP is the first pre-college STEM education program that is both a U.S. national initiative and implemented as an on-orbit commercial space venture. 
Designing experiments with gravity turned off is exciting!
Students follow real-world research processes
Students collaborate with scientists
Other Ways You Can HelpPlease share and help me turn my students on to science in action!
Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
You can use the Indiegogo share tools!
If you want to help more, we are eager to put iPads into their hands. 
Challenge based learning requires real-world tools.
Students need access to technology that is commonly used in the 21st century, life, and work.
This includes computers, rich media creation tools, the internet, and mobile devices for anytime, anywhere access to information, content and communication.

- Created to Address U.S. Strategic Need: high caliber STEM education program tuned to next generation national science education standards; designed to be a pedagogical model for inspiring and engaging next generation of American scientists and engineers, in order to address U.S. strategic need in workforce development for the 21st century marketplace. - True STEM Education Initiative: real experiment design across all science disciplines (physical, chemical, and biological); seamless fusion with technology, engineering, and mathematics; interdisciplinary with writing, oral communication, and art and design.- Systemic Initiative: applicable across an entire school district, addressing state and local strategic needs in STEM education, next gen national science standards, and applicable across grades 5-14.- Community Engagement Model for STEM Education: broader SSEP program designed to engage students across grades K-14, teachers, families, civic and business organizations, and research institutions.- Track Record: to date, 7 SSEP flight opportunities have been undertaken, engaging 68 communities in the U.S. and Canada, and providing 104,000 grade 5-14 students the ability to participate; gave rise to 28,300 grade 5-14 students fully immersed in microgravity experiment design and proposal writing; 6,435 flight experiment proposals by student teams were received; 81 experiments have flown on Space Shuttles and to ISS, and 15 more experiments are slated to fly in Spring 2014; - Authentic Immersion in Scientific Research: SSEP precisely models the breadth and depth of real research by the professional community, including definition of a research program by a research team with PIs, Co-Is and Collaborators; writing proposals against a real proposal guideline with a formal evaluation rubric; a real 2-step proposal review process; formal NASA flight safety review for selected experiments; and a research conference at the Smithsonian's National Air and Space Museum.  -Deep Investment in Partnership: over 350 Local Partners, including: school districts, private schools, NASA Space Grant lead institutions and other universities, businesses, foundations, private philanthropists, and local research institutions providing science advisors.-High Profile Program: garnering very significant media coverage at the local, regional, and national level, with launches at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center and SSEP delegations in attendance, and experiments aboard the International Space Station with an astronaut assigned to the payload. -High Profile Strategic Partners: NASA, Smithsonian Institution, NanoRacks-Breaking New Ground in Commercial Space: SSEP is the first pre-college STEM education program that is both a U.S. national initiative and implemented as an on-orbit commercial space venture. 
If total funds are not acquired the money raised will go toward establishing a portable tablet lab. 


And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Our Vision

We're asking Oakland middle schoolers to take science to the next level - outer space!  Urban Promise Academy, a public middle school in Oakland's Fruitvale neighborhood, has been selected to participate in the Student Spaceflight Experiment Program.  This means:

  • Over 300 students learning about microgravity, the International Space Station, and experimental design
  • Teams of students develop their own spaceflight experiment proposals
  • A school-wide competition to select the best 6th, 7th, and 8th grade proposals
  • One winning proposal will be selected by a team at the Smithsonian and students will attend a conference in Washington, DC
  • Winning proposal becomes a reality - the experiment is actually sent to the International Space Station!

This is a tremendous opportunity for any community, but particularly for our students who are underrepresented in colleges and scientific professions. Our student body is 87 percent Latino, 4 percent African American, 7 percent Asian, 1 percent multi-ethnic, and 1 percent White. 56 percent of our students are English Learners while another 41 percent have been re-designated as Fluent English Proficient students. 90 percent of students qualify for free and reduced lunch and seven percent of our students are identified as needing special education services.  


What We Need & What You Get

We have currently raised over $21,000 in order for Oakland to participate in Mission 6 to the International Space Station through support from our school, district, and local foundations!  Phew!  Now, we're looking for your support for our Ground Truth experiments:

  • Experimental materials - plant seeds, growth mediums, petri dishes, fixatives, activators, bacterial cultures, stains, and more for all 3 grade levels!  
  • Safety equipment - goggles, gloves, sterilizing materials to keep our students safe.

Many of these materials are reusable, so your contribution will support us long into the future.

Perks!

  • $25 = personal thank you letter from students & staff
  • $100 = UPA shirt

The Impact

As you are reading this, we have 23 student experiments being conducted on Space Station right now, launched on Orb-1 on January 9, 2014, from the Mid-Atlantic Regional Spaceport, Wallops Island, VA. These 23 experiments represent the culmination of 8,680 grade 5-12 students fully engaged in microgravity experiment design across the 23 participating communities, and 1,841 flight experiment proposals submitted by student teams. We want UPA students to be a part of this authentic scientific inquiry!



Other Ways You Can Help

We understand fully that not everyone is in a position to donate but there are still many other ways that you can help us tell this story. Here are a few:

  • Support our students in-person or via email throughout the proposal writing process or serve as a community judge by reading final proposals!
  • Ask your friends and family to help get the word out and make some noise. Your voice is the most powerful tool you have, please use it to help a worthwhile cause.
  • Share this campaign via Twitter or Facebook.
  • Share this campaign through your business or organization, Facebook, Twitter, E-Blasts, List-serves, and any possible way to spread the word.

story:
Short Summary

Would you like to help children expand their mind in more ways than one? You can, through a new and innovative program which will help students become more aware of the cultures and languages that make up the world as a whole. East Austin College Prep is sending 15 students to Europe to attend local schools, travel to London, Paris, and Berlin, and learn about the cultures and languages of Europe.

Many children in our society, especially those in East Austin a traditionally economically disadvantaged and minority community, have limited or nonexistent opportunities to experience life - not just life outside their community or state, but their country as well.  Living in a low socioeconomic community, these children can only dream about the possibility of experiencing a culture completely different than their own. 

Here at East Austin College Prep, the majority of our students (98%) are at, or below the poverty rate.  Due to these circumstances, many do not get a chance to buy food or personal items for themselves (e.g. shoes, school uniforms, other basic living essentials).  Unfortunately many don't even know what world exists outside of Austin, let alone, the world outside of the US. 

What We Need & What You Get

With your help and support, we strongly believe this unique international experience will be an immeasurable one in their young lives.  We believe this experience will give them the drive and dedication to continue their studies and become more than just school leaders but world leaders and citizens.  Any amount of funding would be greatly beneficial as it will go a long way.  We sincerely hope and would greatly appreciate your help in reaching our goal to make this opportunity for the children possible. 

The Impact

At EA College Prep, we have the ambitious idea of providing our students, and by extension, our community, an opportunity to leave their comfort zones and experience a whole new world. As a participating student in the Europe Excursion trip, students will be exposed to the culture and ambiance of London, Paris, and Berlin. In addition to visiting the typical historical and monumental areas, the students will also be visiting three different Universities (University of London, American University of Paris and Freie Universitat Berlin) while in each respective city.  In addition, students will also be visiting and briefly attending local secondary schools.  This is where the students will steer away from the traditional touristic life and immerse themselves into a local setting and way of life by attending classes with their English, French and German counterparts. They will be representing our prestigious school and city as ambassadors and scholars. This stands as a unique opportunity for students to experience diverse cultures, travel overseas, and visit the epicenter of our Western Civilization. Please help our students to have this amazing experience!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Who Are We?

We are a group of very dedicated Egyptian Muslims who have acquired the personal obligatory knowledge of the Religion with a sanad (chain) of transmission that goes back to our Master Prophet Muhammad, Sallallaahu `alayhi wa sallam. This is the knowledge taught in the oldest University in the world, Al-Azhar University of Egypt, which still holds the correct Creed of Sunni Muslims in this time of prevalent darkness and ignorance.

We are members of Sirajul Muhtadeen Association (SMA) of Egypt and spread the Religious knowledge under its care and guidance. This is a registered association in Cairo, Egypt. Registration number and date of SMA:
جمعية سراج المهتدين المشهرة برقم 8512 بتاريخ 18/1/2012
Sirajul Muhtadeen Association number: 8512
Date: 18th of January 2012

We live in different parts of Egypt and travel to its many towns and cities spreading the knowledge that was transmitted to us through reliable, trustworthy teachers. We have among us those who are strong and fluent in both the Arabic and English languages and we utilize these skills as much as we can.

Our `Aqidah (creed) is that of Ahlus Sunnah, the majority of this nation, and we follow the four great Imams: Abu Hanifah, Malik, Ash-Shafi`iyy, and Ahmad.

The belief of Ahlus Sunnah is that every Muslim is obligated to know that our Creator, the Exalted, does not resemble His creations in any way whatsoever. Allah is not a body, shape, or picture, nor an actual light/illumination, rather He is the Creator of all of them. Allah exists without a 'how' and without a place. No mind can imagine Him. Allah said in the Qur'an: {( ليس كمثله شئ )} which means: {Nothing resembles Him in any way} Imam At-Tahawiyy, one of the great hanafiyy scholars, said what means: “Allah is supremely clear of all boundaries, extremes, sides, organs, and instruments. The six directions do not contain Him, for these are attributed to all created things.”

It is also obligatory upon us to know that every Prophet of Allah, before and after Prophethood, is truthful, intelligent, beautiful in shape, protected from committing blasphemy, enormous sins, and small abject sins, and clear from being inflicted with repelling ailments.

We love the Prophet, may peace be upon him, his Companions, his blessed family members, and all of the awliyaa' (highly righteous and upright slaves). We are working to spread peace, harmony, and unity between Muslims and we believe that knowledge and moderation are our most significant tools. Unlike those who gave no consideration to logic and reason, and by that became extreme fanatics, we, on the other hand, use both our sound minds and the Religious evidence thus complying with the saying of the Islamic scholars: “Using the mind without using the revelation is like stepping into the darkness with your eyes open, and using the revelation without using your mind is like stepping into the light with your eyes closed.”

Who Are We Warning Against? Are They Really THAT Dangerous? 

We are warning against all extremist ideologies and every terrorist idea existing in Egypt and even outside of Egypt. It is known for most people that the situation of Egypt right now is very weak, in all its aspects, and we blame the terrorists and extremists who are spreading corruption in our country in the name of Islam while Islam is pure of their actions. These people have deviated from the true teachings of Prophet Muhammad and are working towards destroying Islamic heritage and tradition all around the world. Islam does not teach extremism. In fact, our greatest teacher and role model, Prophet Muhammad, may peace be upon him, said what means: “The extremist fanatics are doomed.” Furthermore, the Prophet taught us to be humble and moderate when he said, “You neglect the best of worship—humbleness.” This is the message we want to bring back to the minds of the Egyptian people while strengthening them with the knowledge of Tawheed (creed) and Fiqh (jurisprudence) so they can differentiate between the people of truth and moderation and those trying to cheat them in their Religion.

What makes these enemies of Islam so dangerous is their claim to being from among the Sunni population and hence they dress and look like us, so how can the laypeople distinguish between who is on the right path and who has deviated from the truth except by way of knowledge? Prophet Muhammad, Sallallaahu `alayhi wa sallam, warned us against those who deviate from him in a hadith related by Al-Bukhariyy and Muslim:

( أناس من جلدتنا، يتكلمون بألسنتنا، تعرف منهم وتنكر، دعاة على أبواب جهنم من أطاعهم قذفوه فيها )

which means: “There are people whose skin is the same color as ours, who speak the same language as we speak, (but) they mix correct matters which you﻿ know with bad matters which you denounce [they mix the correct statements with the deviated ones]. They stand by the gates of Hellfire inviting others to enter. Whoever listens to them, they push him in.”

These are the people whom we are warning against with our knowledge, diligence, and engaging and sincere teamwork.

What Will the Money Raised Be Spent On?

The money raised will be used to facilitate the propagation of the authentic knowledge of Ahlus Sunnah wal-Jamaa`ah, the knowledge taught by Prophet Muhammad to his Companions and from them to their followers and from the followers to their followers until reaching us today.

There are 2 main things we hope to gain with this money:

1. An inexpensive, second-hand car to be used by teachers and students to move from place to place to conduct live lessons and events.

Your contribution for this effort means so much to us. Having a car for da`wah purposes will help us give more lessons than we are giving now. It will help us travel to further towns to spread knowledge and be able to reach those who want to learn but have no reliable teachers in their area. The one entrusted with the car will be permitted to use it for personal reasons if it comes down  to it. The amount we are asking for is not very much because we are only seeking a reliable means of transportation (not including gas money).

Our contributors can can contribute to this campaign anywhere from $1 to $1,000.

Keep in mind that $1 is equivalent to 6.97 Egyptian Pounds.

2. A Da`wah laptop or other device like a tablet for giving lessons.

We are seeking your help in buying a laptop or tablet to use while giving lessons. This will help the teacher through the ease of not having to carry around books (Yes! We actually carry around books, like the old scholars did, to give lessons from. We do not speak from our opinions like misguided people do). This option will enable us to download lessons straight to the laptop or tablet, even download books, and carry it along to lessons and events.

For those who wish to use PayPal they can donate this way by using the following PayPal email address: goldentrees98@gmail.com

PayPal takes out about 5.4% of the amount one contributes for using their service. To avoid this fee, the person donating needs to select "Family and Friends" and not "Goods and Services".

NOTE:  If we surpass our desired goal, then we kindly take your permission to use the excess amount of money towards general da`wah spending. Thank you.

So What Do YOU Get Out of All of This?

Muslims know that the reward for any effort they make in supporting the truth is never lost if it was sincere, so don't forget the sincere intentions! And this reward is more immense than any worldly benefit one may acquire. Moreover, anyone who supports us is supporting a global warning against extremism and terrorism. While we are a small group at the moment, we are very dedicated and determined to keep moving forward and spreading the true belief of Muslims. By eradicating terrorism we all would gain peace of mind, a certain level of trust, and some safety in the world we live today. While this is probably a long journey, every footstep counts and nothing will be achieved without that first, ambitious step.

Our Last Words

We said just about everything we wanted to say, but just in case we missed anything, or you wish to inquire about more details or want to speak to us, please feel free to email us at sunnimuslimsofegypt@gmail.com

***Anyone searching for FREE live online lessons given by trustworthy teachers who have a strong chain of knowledge, or looking for a reliable teacher in their area, can also email us and we will try to help, God-willing.***

Once again, we ask that you help us in donating towards this significant cause. Terrorism is a reality, not something made up on Media TV. It is a poison that needs to be eradicated. There are many fundraising campaigns on here geared towards helping individuals with diseases and illnesses, and animal campaigns, but we strongly believe that terrorism is a much, much great threat to our world. We are living through it and we witness it every day. Please help us make a change to the situation of Egypt.

I Wish I Can Contribute, But...

Not everyone can contribute, although many may want to. So we ask that you at least spread this ad to just one other person. Helping can be that simple. If you have any other ideas or suggestions that can help us in what we are requesting please email us. Thank you.

We ask God to protect the Egyptian people from extremists trying to take over the country to satisfy their own, personal agendas. We ask God to grant us victory in our effort to stopping terrorism and teaching the people the true, moderate way of Islam.

***If you made it this far in reading, we just want to thank you for your time! Even if you do not contribute or help in any way, we hope that you at least know that Muslims are truly against terrorism, as many non-Muslims are, and many of us are working very hard to spread the true teachings of Prophet Muhammad in hopes of eradicating fabrications, deviance, and misguidance. All praise and thanks are due to God alone and He knows best.***

Muslims and we believe that knowledge and moderation are our most 
significant tools. Unlike those who gave no consideration to logic and 
reason, and by that became extreme fanatics, we, on the other hand, use 
both our sound minds and the Religious evidence thus complying with the 
saying of the Islamic scholars: “Using
the mind without using the revelation is like stepping into the darkness with
your eyes open, and using the revelation without using your mind is like
stepping into the light with your eyes closed.” Who Are We Warning Against? Are They Really THAT Dangerous?  
We
are warning against all
extremist ideologies and every terrorist idea existing in Egypt and even
 outside of Egypt. It is known
for most people that the situation of Egypt right now is very weak, in 
all its
aspects, and we blame the terrorists and extremists who are spreading
corruption in our country in the name of Islam while Islam is pure of 
their
actions. These people have deviated from the true teachings of Prophet 
Muhammad and are working towards destroying Islamic heritage and 
tradition all around the world. Islam does not teach extremism. In fact,
 our greatest teacher and role
model, Prophet Muhammad, may peace be upon him, said what means: “The 
extremist
fanatics are doomed.” Furthermore, the Prophet taught us to be humble 
and moderate when he
said, “You neglect the best of worship—humbleness.” This is the message 
we want
to bring back to the minds of the Egyptian people while strengthening 
them with
the knowledge of Tawheed (creed) and Fiqh (jurisprudence) so they can 
differentiate between the people of truth and moderation and those 
trying to cheat them in their Religion.
What makes these enemies of Islam so dangerous is their claim to being from
among the Sunni population and hence they dress and look like us, so how can
the laypeople distinguish between who is on the right path and who has deviated
from the truth except by way of knowledge? Prophet
Muhammad, Sallallaahu `alayhi wa sallam, warned us against those who deviate
from him in a hadith related by Al-Bukhariyy and Muslim: 

( أناس من جلدتنا، يتكلمون بألسنتنا، تعرف منهم وتنكر، دعاة على
أبواب جهنم من أطاعهم قذفوه فيها )
which
means: “There are people whose skin is the same color as ours, who speak the
same language as we speak, (but) they mix correct matters which you﻿ know with
bad matters which you denounce [they mix the correct statements with the
deviated ones]. They stand by the gates of Hellfire inviting others to enter.
Whoever listens to them, they push him in.”
These
are the people whom we are warning against with our knowledge, diligence, and
engaging and sincere teamwork. 
What Will the Money Raised Be Spent On?
The
money raised will be used to facilitate the propagation of the authentic
knowledge of Ahlus Sunnah wal-Jamaa`ah, the knowledge taught by Prophet
Muhammad to his Companions and from them to their followers and from the
followers to their followers until reaching us today. 
There
are 2 main things we hope to gain with this money:
1.
An inexpensive, second-hand car to be used by teachers and students to move from place
to place to conduct live lessons and events. 
Your
contribution for this effort means so much to us. Having a car for da`wah
purposes will help us give more lessons than we are giving now. It will help us
travel to further towns to spread knowledge and be able to reach those who want
to learn but have no reliable teachers in their area. The one entrusted with the car will be permitted to use it for personal reasons if it comes down  to it. The amount we are asking
for is not very much because we are only seeking a reliable means of
transportation (not including gas money). 
Our contributors can can contribute to this campaign anywhere from $1 to $1,000.

Keep
in mind that $1 is equivalent to 6.97 Egyptian Pounds.
2.
A Da`wah laptop or other device like a tablet for giving lessons.
We are seeking
your help in buying a laptop or tablet to use while giving lessons. This will
help the teacher through the ease of not having to carry around books (Yes! We
actually carry around books, like the old scholars did, to give lessons from.
We do not speak from our opinions like misguided people do). This option will
enable us to download lessons straight to the laptop or tablet, even download
books, and carry it along to lessons and events.For those who wish to use PayPal they can donate this way by using the following PayPal email address: goldentrees98@gmail.comPayPal takes out about 5.4% of the amount one contributes for using their service. To avoid this fee, the person donating needs to select "Family and Friends" and not "Goods and Services".NOTE:  If 
we surpass our desired goal, then we kindly take your permission to use 
the excess amount of money towards general da`wah spending. Thank you.

So What Do YOU Get Out of All of This?
Muslims know that the reward for any effort
they make in supporting the truth is never lost if it was sincere, so 
don't
forget the sincere intentions! And this reward is more immense than any 
worldly
benefit one may acquire. Moreover, anyone who supports us is supporting a
 global warning against
extremism and terrorism. While we are a small group at the moment, we 
are very
dedicated and determined to keep moving forward and spreading the true 
belief
of Muslims. By eradicating terrorism we all would gain peace of mind, a 
certain level of trust, and some safety in the world we live today. 
While this is probably a long
journey, every footstep counts and nothing will be achieved without that
 first,
ambitious step.
Our Last Words
We
said just about everything we wanted to say, but just in case we missed
anything, or you wish to inquire about more details or want to speak to us,
please feel free to email us at sunnimuslimsofegypt@gmail.com
***Anyone
searching for FREE live online lessons given by trustworthy teachers who have a
strong chain of knowledge, or looking for a reliable teacher in their area, can
also email us and we will try to help, God-willing.***
Once
again, we ask that you help us in donating towards this significant cause.
Terrorism is a reality, not something made up on Media TV. It is a poison that
needs to be eradicated. There are many fundraising campaigns on here geared
towards helping individuals with diseases and illnesses, and animal campaigns, but we strongly believe
that terrorism is a much, much great threat to our world. We are living through it and we witness it
every day. Please help us make a change to the situation of Egypt. 
I Wish I Can Contribute, But...
Not
everyone can contribute, although many may want to. So we ask that you at least
spread this ad to just one other person. Helping can be that simple. If
you have any other ideas or suggestions that can help us in what we are
requesting please email us. Thank you.
We
ask God to protect the Egyptian people from extremists trying to take over the
country to satisfy their own, personal agendas. We ask God to grant us victory
in our effort to stopping terrorism and teaching the people the true, moderate way of
Islam.
***If
you made it this far in reading, we just want to thank you for your time! Even
if you do not contribute or help in any way, we hope that you at least know
that Muslims are truly against terrorism, as many non-Muslims are, and many of
us are working very hard to spread the true teachings of Prophet Muhammad in
hopes of eradicating fabrications, deviance, and misguidance. All praise and
thanks are due to God alone and He knows best.***

story:
THANK YOU ALL!

Monday, 01/13/14 1:40 PM

We did it. We hit our $10,000 goal with 11 hours to spare. No. 1 #schoolgarden fan Diana Heffernan of Palos Verdes put us over the top with a $1,000 contribution. Thanks to her and everyone else.

Yes, thank you all. But not being the unbusy types we've gotten a matching offer from a lovely donor, Ismael Resendiz of http://www.resendizbrothers.com in Fallbrook. If we raise $12,000 by the deadline, they donate an additional $2000 in cutflower plants for our ranch. Banksias, proteas, waxflower and other lovely Australian, drought tolerant natives are on the table, literally. 

We have many perks to match your contributions: csa shares, flower shares, bulbs, t-shirts, farm dinners and 1-on-1 classes with me. Good stuff -- 'even hanging out with this florist farmer. ;)

This is our first crowd funding campaign and we are thrilled. We'll be able to plant more, sell more and hire more Muir students in 2014. It's a win/win/win. But while we have folks attention, lets do even more good by doing good. 

Thanks!

mud


Help us build the Pasadena Rose Garden at Muir Ranch. Muir Ranch at John Muir High School is a teen jobs program that looks like a farm, community supported agriculture program (csa) and with your help a rose garden and floral business social enterprise. While you have heard of Pasadena's Rose Parade and our historic Craftsman houses, 80% of Muir students qualify for free and reduced lunch. Northwest Pasadena is considered a food desert and our CSA brings both good food and teen jobs to our neighborhood. The work we do with the support of people like you is, literally, beautiful.

More Roses. More teen jobs.

We have room for 300 more David Austin Rose bushes at our urban farm. 300. David Austin roses are not just roses, they are drop dead gorgeous and approach peony like status in bloom count. The scent? Heaven. It's not the scent of what you'd find at a everyday floral shop. Additionally, Pasadena doesn't have a proper, public "rose garden" or actual arboretum so we decided to combine a working farm with a public garden as we grow our school garden program. Currently we employ about a dozen students year round. We'd like to double that in 2014. We need $10,000 to buy and install more shrubs. We;ll need an expansion of our current irrigation system. And we need an improved website and marketing materials that will aid our students in their social enterprise efforts. 

Buy an Austin. Give an Austin.

To make help you make us really awesome we are offering kale seeds, t-shirts, dinner tickets, but most importantly, roses. It's bare root season and when you buy a rose from us you will be purchasing one as well for Muir Ranch. Think TOMS Shoes crossed with a plant nursery that benefits a school garden. Yay! The price of the rose is included in the perk. So buy more and save. We'll plant the sponsored rose bush (or bushes!) with a hand-made ceramic marker featuring your twitter or instagram ID and blast it out to our 30,000 social media followers.

story:
What I Need & Why

  • The cost of the Brown Environemental Leadership Lab is $3,195, not including air fare
  • I have been deeply involved in marine biology since an early age, I began as a camper at the New England Aquarium summer camp, later I began to volunteer there, and last year I attended Coastal Studies for Girls, an all-girls semester school focusing on leadership and marine science.

My application essay:

The ocean has profoundly changed my life, and I would like to attend the Brown Environmental Leadership Lab: New Orleans & Louisiana Gulf Coast program(BELL)to further my education and passion about marine sciences and gain experience in the field in order to inform and support my future career. The program affords the amazing opportunity to experience a part of the United States that I have never seen before, and study New Orleans’ unique environment and the many organisms that call it home. I am also looking forward to meeting and forming relationships with people who are interested in the same field as I. Through the New England Aquarium(NEAq), where I’ve volunteered for over 3 years, and the Coastal Studies for Girls Science and Leadership school, where I spent the spring semester of my sophomore year, I am creating a network of like-minded teenagers and adults who are able to support my aspirations and to share experiences, advice, and adventures with me.

A large part of my love for the oceans and for learning comes from my father. When I was a child, my father worked at the NEAq and he often brought me with him. I was exposed to many different aspects of his job as head of the teacher resource department. I loved being taken into the wet lab and helping to feed the fish. I took naps in the bin of stuffed whales and penguins and helped remind patrons to keep the animals in the underwater touch tank. I felt special and important because I knew the inner workings of such a magical place. As I got older, I developed a passion and love for marine life and ecosystems. The aquarium has been a “home away from home” for me, and it has greatly shaped my interests.

I knew from a young age that I wanted to work at the NEAq and to teach people about animals out in the field, but I didn't know how to achieve my goal. I was up against some pretty serious challenges. When I was about six or seven years old, I read at a kindergarten level. My A.D.D (Attention Deficit Disorder) and Dyslexia were so severe that the school told my parents that I might need to transfer into a substantially separate Special Education classroom or repeat first grade. My parents did not give up on me, and decided that repeating first grade was the best option. I went on through elementary school with mediocre grades and unruly behavior. The summer after fifth grade was the first summer I attended the New England Aquarium’s summer camp, Harbor Discoveries. This summer drastically changed the course of my life. All of a sudden, becoming a marine biologist seemed within reach. I learned that to get what I wanted I would have to work hard to be as smart as the counselors and scientists surrounding me. When Fall came around, I walked into middle school ready to get good grades and learn, and I did just that. I progressed throughout middle school taking the only honors class (math) offered and I loved every moment of it!

By my freshmen year, I knew I wanted to teach people about marine organisms, habitats, and how they impact human life. That’s when I learned about Coastal Studies For Girls, an all-girls semester school in Southern Maine. I decided right away that I was going to go to that school! I was accepted and spent an amazing sixteen weeks honing my scientific and critical thinking skills, creating lifelong friendships, and learning about the ecology of the Maine coast. The semester was a great success for me, and it would never have been so positive without my ability to persevere through difficult situations. From running my first 5k to handling twelve roommates, I attacked every challenge head-on. Time management issues and my learning disabilities slowed me down, but I have proved to myself that I can do absolutely anything I set my mind to.

The ocean has so profoundly changed my life, that I want to do my part to give back. I want the opportunity to show people the tight-knit relationship that we all have with the ocean and its ecosystems. Recently in a NEAq meeting, a boy named Andrew surprised all us “geeky Ocean lovers” by saying that he did not love the Ocean at all. He didn’t like swimming or fish, not even the beach. It is my goal to spread the millions of reasons he, and everyone, should love the Ocean. I want to share with him that most of the oxygen in the atmosphere is generated by the sea, that his favorite ice cream flavor has seaweed in it, and that if humans aren't careful we could lose so much that we depend on. By attending Brown Environmental Leadership Lab, I will learn what I need to be better prepared to advocate for the oceans and will able to reach out to new people whose experiences and opinions will help shape my love of our blue planet.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't offer me monitary aid doesn’t mean you can’t help, please share my story and this page on your facebook and other social media sites to get the word out.

story:
Short Summary

  My name is Danielle. I am a junior majoring in Environmental Studies. I have a passion for marine ecosystems, sharks especially. 
  This June, I would like to travel to Mossel Bay, South Africa as a part of the Oceans Campus internship program. My program of study is that of the Marine Conservation & Education Internship. With this, I will teach South African youth, including underprivileged areas, the importance of creating and maintaining ocean stewardship. I will be focusing on shark biology and ocean ecology. I will have the opportunity to interact and raise money for communities in the area as well.
  The hardest part will be getting there,which is where I need your help! Any and all donations are encouraged and all proceeds will be funding the trip.

What I Need 

Donations will fund:

  • Round-trip plane ticket
  • Cost of internship
  • Passport
  • Excursions including cage diving and a safari.

The Impact

Marine ecosystems are being depleted of their biodiversity at an alarming rate due to the over-consumption of fish and other valuable species. With this internship, I will see this problem first-hand and I will be able to use my new-found and previous education to inform South African children on how to properly care for and protect our oceans. If you would like to learn more about Oceans Campus and my internship, please visit www.oceans-campus.com.


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word! Post the link to my Indigogo on your Facebook wall, tweet it, email it, write it on bathroom stalls ---just get the word out!
  • Take the time to educate yourself on ocean environments and what you can do to help (This is a really awesome site! lessthanemily.tumblr.com )

story:
Greetings! My name is Amy Van Landingham, your comrade in arms in making the world a better place. In August of 2013, I was invited by my close friend, Lee FitzGerald, to be a board member of Dristi Nepal, a registered 501(c)(3) non-profit. Dristi Nepal's vision is to provide treatment and support for female drug users, help reintegrate them into society, as well as HIV education & prevention. Since 2008, Dristi Nepal's drop-in clinic in Kathmandu has helped over 500 women in Nepal find a new way to live. But we're not stopping there!

Here's what Dristi Nepal does for women: 

OBJECTIVES

· To provide an environment for care to female drug users and their children

· To provide skills-based programs

· To advocate for the rights of female ex-drug users

· To reintegrate female drug users into the community

· To raise awareness about drugs and HIV/AIDS in the communities

SERVICES

· Drop-In Center (DIC) with a friendly environment

· Education and outreach services

· Awareness

· Individual and family counseling

· Recreational activities

· Primary health care for drug users and the community

By contributing to my Indiegogo campaign, you are supporting the event by enabling me to buy an Economy ticket to London to support the Dristi Nepal's Fundraising Gala on May 6, 2014 - the first time Dristi Nepal has ventured into Europe. I am traveling there as a board member to volunteer my 3 years experience coordinating 100+ marketing events, and my experience as a production manager since February of 2013, and passion for social change to make the event a huge success. Having experienced staff volunteering their time will be invaluable to our success. 

In exchange for your contributions, you will receive: 

  • A tax write off for your donation! Dristi Nepal is a registered 501(c)(3), and you will get a receipt for your accounting purposes. 
  • A digital photo album of the event, delivered electronically upon my return.
  • A postcard from London from yours truly, thanking you personally for your contribution.
  • A video of us at the event thanking you personally.
  • A personal thank you on our website.
  • A souvenir from the event itself - one of a kind!
  • The peace of mind knowing that you've helped make the world a better place - PRICELESS!

Can't contribute monetarily? Help out by sharing my campaign with anyone you feel would want to help, or spread the word. No contribution is too big or too small! Pitch in a penny, a buck, five, ten, 50, Starbucks money, whatever you have to give! I am so grateful to get to be of service to women in need in such a big way. Thank you for fighting the good fight with me!

Email me at amy@dristinepal.com with any questions/concerns/suggestions. 


Watch this video for details the story behind Dristi Nepal, and how it works:

contribution is too big or too small! Pitch in a penny, a buck, five, ten, 50,
Starbucks money, whatever you have to give! I am so grateful to get to be of
service to women in need in such a big way. Thank you for fighting the good
fight with me!
Email
me at amy@dristinepal.com with any questions/concerns/suggestions. 
Watch this video for details the story behind Dristi Nepal, and how it works:

story:
Hello friends, family and colleagues. As you may know, I recently became a licensed Marriage and Family Therapist Intern, and I'm just starting to see my first clients at a private practice in Auburn, California. My first appointment with a client was literally last weekend!

My decision to become a therapist came after a ten-year career as a mental health social worker, during which time several of my colleagues and clients told me they thought I'd make a good therapist. Eventually, I became enthusiastic about the idea myself. I spent the last two years studying Couples and Family Therapy, graduating in August with a Master's degree from the California School of Professional Psychology.

This campaign is about helping me help others in my new role as a therapist. I have a goal of becoming a certified practitioner of EMDR (Eye Movement Desensitization & Reprocessing), a highly effective therapeutic technique designed to help people who have suffered through trauma. I need your help to make this happen!

See my Psychology Today Profile

How I can use EMDR to serve my clients

Getting certified to practice EMDR requires two weekends of training, along with consultation from an established EMDR practitioner. Last July, I completed my first weekend of training and went through the necessary consultation. All I have left is the second weekend -- and that's what I'm reaching out to you about today.

Since August, I’ve been very busy setting up my career in private practice. I succeeded in finding a supervisor, and I’ve been working with her on reorganizing her business to accommodate an MFT intern. With all this preliminary work to do, I haven’t had any income since graduating in August. Thanks to my wife, family, and student loans, I’ve made it this far, but I simply don't have the funds to pay for weekend two of my EMDR training.

Meet My Supervisor Merrill Powers

If I can raise the funds I need to complete the training, I'll be able to help those suffering from the effects of trauma in my private practice. Without EMDR training, I'll have to turn many of my trauma clients away, referring them to other practitioners, and some may not be able to find EMDR therapy they can afford. As a therapist intern, I give clients the option of low-cost therapy, adjusting my fees according to what they can afford. These lowered fees mean I can serve people who might not be able to pay for therapy otherwise. Also, my clients can afford more sessions, improving their chances of positive therapeutic outcomes.

If I could practice EMDR, this would be even better news for my clients, because EMDR has been shown in many clinical trials to be much more efficient than traditional relational talk therapies when it comes to alleviating symptoms of trauma. I've experienced the impact of this modality firsthand while doing the first half of my training, and I know it to be effective. In as little as three sessions, clients with trauma can see significantly better results than they would from talk therapy. Integrating low-cost EMDR into my practice will help more families, parents and children heal the sense of isolation that untreated trauma perpetuates.

Q and A with the EMDR Founder and EMDR Studies

What your contribution can do

Every dollar I raise towards my goal will be used to pay for the completion of my EMDR training with Roy Kiessling, LISW, an EMDRIA-approved EMDR Basic Training trainer. Roy is considered one of the premiere EMDR Basic Trainers in the United States, having facilitated over 200 Basic Trainings. He’s been awarded for his outstanding volunteer contributions to the EMDR Humanitarian Assistance Program Community, which allows volunteers to provide free EMDR services to those impacted by trauma, often via natural disasters, all around the world.

The Weekend Two EMDR Basic Training, by Roy Kiessling

What you'll get in return

What's in it for you? Guess what, not only are you helping me help others, but I'm going to use some of my existing training to help you relax! If you like massage, I've been a certified massage therapist since 1995 (I used to be a practitioner in a physical therapy clinic, Employer Benefits Program and Massage Envy), and I still use this hobby today to de-stress family and friends. If massage isn't your thing, I am offering live music played on the Irish bagpipes and pennywhistle, another long-standing hobby of mine; I can provide Irish background music for your house party, wedding, or event of any kind. Your donation, your choice! You can also give your massage or music gift to anyone you wish, assuming they're in the area. I can travel as far as Colfax and as wide as Dixon, or of course anywhere in the greater Sacramento area. I can make special arrangements for those of you in the Bay Area or family out of town! Should you choose to contribute to my campaign, I'll be in touch with you right away to arrange your gift.

The late/great Seamus Ennis-Plays a Reel, on the Irish Bagpipes

Mary Bergin-Plays Reels on her Tin Whistle

Thanks, one and all, for your commitment to helping me help others in my new therapy practice! If you know of anyone I forgot or that you think might get on board with this fundraising (and/or like the "perks" I'm offering!), please share this with them. I truly appreciate all your support.
