story:
Our Story

My name is Alex Cross and my passion is kids and nutrition.  My mom and I had saved for years to take our dream vacation to Costa Rica last summer.  Little did I know that this vacation would give direction to my life.  

 

I met the sweetest little baby (Roy) sitting in a stroller outside a small taco stand.  His mom was about my age and she worked at the stand.  I immediately noticed two things:  1.  Momma was quite overweight and 2. Little Roy was eating beans and tortillas.  These two facts kicked my nutritionist brain into overdrive.  Did momma not know what foods babies need to be healthy?  Did momma know anything about nutrition for herself?

 

As I began to talk to her, I discovered that beans, rice and tortillas were the staples of both of their diets.  She said little Roy began eating the same things she did once she stopped breastfeeding.  I also learned from her that nutrition education was non-existent in schools.

 

This chance meeting stuck with me when we returned to the states.  I was nearing the end of my college career and was looking for a way to use my education in a meaningful way.  I began talking to professsors and fellow nutrition students.  What could I do?  Finally, someone suggested that if I really wanted to do something, I would go back to Costa Rica as a volunteer and teach nutrition.

 

Yes!  That's it!  Now, I had to make a plan.  I looked online for intern and volunteer programs and found a great one -  AIDEabroad.org.  Their mission statement is, "Through education and the exchange of ideas and people across borders, AIDE will build a worldwide community of global citizens who will be part of an ongoing intercultural conversation. AIDE will be a catalyst for change in the world by building bridges between individuals from diverse cultures". Perfect!  Next, I convinced the dean of my department to authorize trading my senior research paper for a 90 day internship in Costa Rica where I would spearhead a nutrition in schools program.

 

Heck, yes!  I found a way to use my education and pursue my passion - teaching kids to live healthy, active lives. 

So, here is the plan:

 

Week 1 - Intense language immersion school.  (I read and write spanish, but my conversational skills need some help!)

Weeks 2-4:  Volunteer in a local medical clinic and pharmacy in order to assess the medical impact of poor nutrition habits on the local children.

Weeks 5-12:  Work with the local AIDE coordinator to write and implement a nutrition program in the local schools (3rd grade though high school). 

 

I am fortunate that the local AIDE coordinator is an American woman whose passion is also nutrition.  She has been waiting for a volunteer intern with a nutrition background to come to Montezuma to spearhead a school nutrition program.  Funny, how things turn out!

 

The Impact

This project will have a huge impact on the lives of the Costa Rican children and adults in the village of Montezuma.  Costa Rica as a whole has experienced a recent increase in overweight and obesity especially in children and adolescents. A study of Costa Rican children ages 7 to 12 years found that 34% were overweight (Nunez-Rivas, Monge-Rojas, Leon, & Rosello, 2003).  Costa Rican adolescents also have high saturated fat intake, low levels of activity, and elevated LDL (bad cholesterol) levels that will increase their risk of coronary heart disease as adults (Monge, Beita, 2000).

I am just one person, but I can "Be The Change" in one small village. 

What We Need & What You Get

Now, I have to talk about money. 

 

Cost of round trip airfare - $900.

AIDE program cost - $800 - This includes placement with the local medical clinic, visa assitance, medical insurance, transporation to and from airport, coordination with the university for credit, background checks, etc.

Living expenses - $350/week  - includes housing, meals, laundry, transporation to schools and clinic.

Language immersion school - $400

Supplies for nutrition program - $1,000

 

The total cost of the project is $7,500.  I have saved, begged and borrowed $5,000 on my own.  I still need about $2,500 to make this project happen.  It will happen!

 

If I am unable to meet my fundraising goal, the project will still happen.  Since I will be doing an internship authorized by my university, I will still be eligible for student loans.  I will borrow the last remaining amount through student loan.  Either way, any amount that you contribute will be used 100% towards this nutrition in schools project.

 

What do you get?  Check to the right side of the page for my perks!  You will also get the satisfaction of knowing you helped one girl achieve her dream and helped hundreds of chldren learn to live healthy, active lifestyles!

Other Ways You Can Help

Your financial help will be greatly appreciated, but I know times are tough. If just my Facebook friends donated $5 each, I would exceed my goal!  If you want to help and it's not in your budget, there is something else that you can do.  Post my story via Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc!  Generating buzz about my project is one of the best things you can do to help me get the word out.

 

As Tom's Shoes says, "BE THE CHANGE"!
story_txt:
Our Story
My name is Alex Cross and my passion is kids and nutrition.  My mom and I had saved for years to take our dream vacation to Costa Rica last summer.  Little did I know that this vacation would give direction to my life.  
 
I met the sweetest little baby (Roy) sitting in a stroller outside a small taco stand.  His mom was about my age and she worked at the stand.  I immediately noticed two things:  1.  Momma was quite overweight and 2. Little Roy was eating beans and tortillas.  These two facts kicked my nutritionist brain into overdrive.  Did momma not know what foods babies need to be healthy?  Did momma know anything about nutrition for herself? 
 
As I began to talk to her, I discovered that beans, rice and tortillas were the staples of both of their diets.  She said little Roy began eating the same things she did once she stopped breastfeeding.  I also learned from her that nutrition education was non-existent in schools.
 
This chance meeting stuck with me when we returned to the states.  I was nearing the end of my college career and was looking for a way to use my education in a meaningful way.  I began talking to professsors and fellow nutrition students.  What could I do?  Finally, someone suggested that if I really wanted to do something, I would go back to Costa Rica as a volunteer and teach nutrition.
 
Yes!  That's it!  Now, I had to make a plan.  I looked online for intern and volunteer programs and found a great one -  AIDEabroad.org.  Their mission statement is, "Through education and the exchange of ideas and people across borders, AIDE will build a worldwide community of global citizens who will be part of an ongoing intercultural conversation. AIDE will be a catalyst for change in the world by building bridges between individuals from diverse cultures". Perfect!  Next, I convinced the dean of my department to authorize trading my senior research paper for a 90 day internship in Costa Rica where I would spearhead a nutrition in schools program.
 
Heck, yes!  I found a way to use my education and pursue my passion - teaching kids to live healthy, active lives.  
So, here is the plan:
 
Week 1 - Intense language immersion school.  (I read and write spanish, but my conversational skills need some help!)
Weeks 2-4:  Volunteer in a local medical clinic and pharmacy in order to assess the medical impact of poor nutrition habits on the local children.
Weeks 5-12:  Work with the local AIDE coordinator to write and implement a nutrition program in the local schools (3rd grade though high school).  
 
I am fortunate that the local AIDE coordinator is an American woman whose passion is also nutrition.  She has been waiting for a volunteer intern with a nutrition background to come to Montezuma to spearhead a school nutrition program.  Funny, how things turn out!
 


The Impact
This project will have a huge impact on the lives of the Costa Rican children and adults in the village of Montezuma.  Costa Rica as a whole has experienced a recent increase in overweight and obesity especially in children and adolescents. A study of Costa Rican children ages 7 to 12 years found that 34% were overweight (Nunez-Rivas, Monge-Rojas, Leon, & Rosello, 2003).  Costa Rican adolescents also have high saturated fat intake, low levels of activity, and elevated LDL (bad cholesterol) levels that will increase their risk of coronary heart disease as adults (Monge, Beita, 2000).
I am just one person, but I can "Be The Change" in one small village.  


What We Need & What You Get
Now, I have to talk about money.  
 
Cost of round trip airfare - $900.
AIDE program cost - $800 - This includes placement with the local medical clinic, visa assitance, medical insurance, transporation to and from airport, coordination with the university for credit, background checks, etc.
Living expenses - $350/week  - includes housing, meals, laundry, transporation to schools and clinic.
Language immersion school - $400
Supplies for nutrition program - $1,000
 
The total cost of the project is $7,500.  I have saved, begged and borrowed $5,000 on my own.  I still need about $2,500 to make this project happen.  It will happen!
 
If I am unable to meet my fundraising goal, the project will still happen.  Since I will be doing an internship authorized by my university, I will still be eligible for student loans.  I will borrow the last remaining amount through student loan.  Either way, any amount that you contribute will be used 100% towards this nutrition in schools project.
 
What do you get?  Check to the right side of the page for my perks!  You will also get the satisfaction of knowing you helped one girl achieve her dream and helped hundreds of chldren learn to live healthy, active lifestyles!


Other Ways You Can Help
Your financial help will be greatly appreciated, but I know times are tough. If just my Facebook friends donated $5 each, I would exceed my goal!  If you want to help and it's not in your budget, there is something else that you can do.  Post my story via Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc!  Generating buzz about my project is one of the best things you can do to help me get the word out.
 
As Tom's Shoes says, "BE THE CHANGE"!

story: Our Story: Holly Feland was born and raised in Torrance, California. Growing up Holly was a shy child. When she was five years old, her mother put her in dance to break her out of her shell. Although she didn't stick with dance, Holly grew to love performing. Holly's love of acting flourished when she discovered theatre. In her theatre debut, she was cast as Goldilocks in "Goldilocks and the Three Bears." She has since played various roles, from Helen in "Baby with the Bathwater," to Lily St.Regis in "Annie," to Agnes in "Agnes of God." Holly transitioned over to film in 2008 when she was cast as Jenny in the independent short film "Johnny Angel." Since then she has done various television commercials and one-hour specials. Her latest film "You People" won several awards in the festival circuit, including "Official Finalist" at the Las Vegas International Film Festival. Holly is currently living in Los Angeles pursuing her acting career. She is known for her natural girl-next-door looks, endearing smile, and quirky charm. In order to advance her skill as an actor, Holly has decided to go back to school, and the Howard Fine Studio in Hollywood is clearly the best choice for her needs. Howard Fine is considered one of the premiere acting coaches worldwide. His students gain a deep understanding of the artistic process, and also develop the tools needed to create multi-dimensional characters and give dynamic performances. Students at the Howard Fine Studio start by taking a 12 week Comprehensive Technique course that focuses on the teachings of Uta Hagen, a pioneer in acting technique. What We Need: We are trying to raise tuition money to allow Holly Feland to be a student in Howard Fine's next Comprehensive Technique course. All donations will go directly towards class expenses. (Either the $1600 tuition or relative expenses including books and transportation.) What You Get: By donating to our tuition fundraiser, you are helping to expand Holly's work qualifications and increase her chances of making it in the business. Imagine how awesome it would be to watch Holly up on the big screen! Well, you can help make that happen! Holly is dedicated to her craft, and wishes only to give the best performances. In exchange for your donations you will receive updates from Holly regarding the course, never-ending gratitude, and hours of entertainment from movies and television programs featuring Holly Feland. *Donations of $20 or more will receive special perks. See below for details. Other Ways You Can Help: Help get the word out! By directing people to our fundraiser (through facebook, website, e-mail, or word-of-mouth) you are increasing Holly's chances of achieving her goals.

story:
Our Story

Four year ago my wife who is a High School teacher came home almost in tears because one of her ELL students who was an outstanding student did not think he was going to be able to attend college. Neither he nor his parent had the financial means to provide for the cost of tuition. It hits us both very hard as we are both first generation English speaking Hispanics. We remember how tough it was growing up in non-english speaking household and not knowing English when starting kindergarten. We decided to start a $1,000 scholarship with the help of the High School she works at to help out this young man. We are not rich by any mean, just good hearted people that feel it is our duty as Americans to Bless others. We have currently 3 recipients of â€œEducate it Forward â€“ ESL Hispanic Heritage Scholarship Awardâ€. Last year recipient was from Florida. I got an email out of the blue from this young man asking about our scholarship program. We contacted the Head of ELL at his school and she set up a new location for our scholarship. Our goal has been to be able to give a full 4 year scholarship each year. The $1,000 scholarship is a good start but not enough to make the full impact of educating a potential Hispanic young man or woman whom one day would pass on his/her Blessing with others. Our vision is of an â€œEducate It Forwardâ€ campaign that never stops giving to educating current and future Hispanics.


The Impact From A Past Recipient

It is an amazing experience to receive support, or a scholarship for the great work you did, or the good grades you received. However, to receive help for the situation you went through, a situation that you can share with other individuals is something I believe to be much greater. The acknowledgement that one receives for the tough times they went through, specifically of not knowing English, is greatly appreciated. This scholarship made me realize that there are many people in this country who are going through the same thing I went through. As well as making me understand, and helping me to not forget my past accomplishments of getting through that stage of learning English, and going to school.

At the time I was applying for this scholarship, I was in great need of it. I needed money to pay for my classes and books for the summer term, and the deadline for that was coming very fast. I ended up taking flex start classes (classes that start later on in the semester and take fewer weeks to finish) because of my lack of money. Once I got the news that I had won the Educate it Forward scholarship, I was just speechless. I had been stressing out over that for so long and now everything had been changed. I was able to pay for my classes and not get behind.

Receiving help from a family member, or a close friend is meaningful, and greatly appreciated. However, to receive help from someone you have never met before makes it all much more meaningful. It shows me that there are people in this world who are willing to help those in great need, without even having to know them personally. Sometimes we forget that the human nature inside of us calls us to reach out to people. The Educate it Forward Scholarship really made a big difference for me. I not only got to pay for my classes in time, but I realized what other people see, and how they want to reach out to the need they see. I really want to thank Mr. and Mrs. Matos for the opportunity they have given me. Not only did I receive financial help, but a greater understanding of how important it is to acknowledge those who have gone through difficult times, and have gotten past them. I thank you once again.

Sincerely,

Francisco Ferreira


What We Need & What You Get

The average annual college cost is about $8,000 and with the addition of one new student each year and it being a 4 year scholarship at any giving time we would have 4 students receiving scholarship money. We need to have an annual budget of $32,000. Be part of this â€œEducate It Forwardâ€ campaign and know that you helped start a movement that will continue forever. If we donâ€™t help our youth today we could be paying for them in the future in the form of jail and social assistance. Make â€œEducate It Forwardâ€ a priority in your life and be an example to others. Please help us start this movement of â€œEducate It Forward". Every dollar counts.

story:
The goal

Education changes lives. Help Douglas College Foundation raise $5,000 to cover tuition fees, financial aid and textbooks for one student for one year, and we will donate a ride-on Mercedes 300 SL convertible to the Ronald McDonald House BC.

The reason

The high cost of living in Metro Vancouver, coupled with increasing tuition fees, is having a serious impact on students.

The payback

Your donation will help a Douglas College student pursue his or her education, while supporting the nurturing and magical home-away-from-home for sick children and their families at the Ronald McDonald House.

If we do not raise the full $5,000, we will hold an auction at Douglas College’s fundraising gala, A Class Act, on Oct. 19, 2012, where the ride-on car will be auctioned and donated to Ronald McDonald House.

Who we are

Douglas College Foundation helps students facing financial challenges stay in school.

Douglas College is one of the largest colleges in British Columbia, providing a variety of bachelor's degrees, university transfer, career and post-degree programs for over 20,000 students each year.

douglascollege.ca

story:
Help us build the next generation of Muslim-Americans

We are the Austin Peace Academy, and we've been giving Central Texas Muslim youth a strong sense of identity, civic responsibility, and academic achievement for the past decade.  Our accredited curriculum consistently produces well-adjusted Muslim youth who win awards at regional & state-level contests and who go on to some of America's best colleges.  

Unfortunately, we're a victim of our own success.

As news of our stellar track record spreads far and wide, the demand for our services has reached an all-time high.  We've managed to outperform many schools at our level while working out of temporary buildings and cramped facilities, but we need to grow to help shape the next generation of Muslim youth, who are facing unprecedented academic, social, and identity pressures.  

An opportunity to double our student body - can you help?

We have an amazing opportunity to acquire a new campus in Leander, TX that meets all of our future needs and will allow us to bring our program to nearly twice the number of students we currently serve.  The new facility includes:

  • Over 13 acres of land, including space for athletics, picnics, and more
  • Two indoor gyms and air-conditioned indoor classrooms
  • A large parking lot with space for our buses

We have been tasked with coming up with the money by June 17, 2013 - that's not far away!  If we miss this opportunity, we will lose the chance of securing this property and will have to return to our cramped, temporary buildings, leaving a hundred Muslim youth without a solid educational foundation.

The stakes are high - we need funds by June 17, 2013!

All you have to do is turn on the news or surf the Internet to see the world that Muslim youth are graduating into - a world full of prejudice, extremism, and pressure to conform.  We have a proven track record of producing Muslim citizens who give back to society, are role models for their peers whether Muslim or not, and are shining examples of how Muslim-Americans are a positive contributor to the American landscape.

But we can't do it without you!

Help us reach our goal!

If you can contribute, please do so.  If you can't, you can help us by getting the word out about our campaign on your social networks.  We would rather have $5 from hundreds of people around the country than a few large donations.

story:
I'm a Real Person:

Hi. My name is Valéria. That's me on the right, smiling (above). That's my wife Amanda on the left. That picture was taken the day a Justice of the Peace married us in Malden, MA.

I grew up in a small town called Mendon, Massachusetts and come from a working-class family. I've been fighting my entire life to achieve my dream of completing a doctorate, and I'm almost there. I completed my B.A. in September 2004 (GPA: 3.95) and my M.A. in May 2007 (GPA: 4.00) and then I got sick.

In July 2007 I was diagnosed with Relapsing-Remitting Multiple Sclerosis. Those white spots you see on my brain are lesions, and they are not supposed to be there:

 

In spite of being diagnosed with MS and being extremely ill from 2007-2009, I persevered and am now, five years later, an "ABD" ("All But Dissertation") PhD candidate in the Luso-Afro-Brazilian Studies & Theory program at UMass Dartmouth. My dissertation examines representations and the aesthetics of disability in Brazilian literature.

In the recent past, I worked as a Research Assistant and instructor of Portuguese at UMass Dartmouth and as a Lecturer of Portugese at UMass Boston (where I expect to be teaching again during academic year 2012-2013). 

Last year---academic year 2011-2012---I was employed as a visiting instructor at Middlebury College in Vermont [LINK OPENS TO .PDF].

If you want, you can see even more about my professional development and just some of my activities as a scholar by going here, here, here and here.

My wife Amanda works at a Starbucks in Boston, where she is a kick-ass barista but, like me, does not make very much money.

Right now, we're stressing over $7464.00. That's the amount standing between us and my lifelong dream. 

I <3 COBRA 4-Eva:

So what do I need? I need exactly $7464.00. What does this amount pay for? It pays for my COBRA premiums for 12 months. I'm lucky enough to have the opportunity to keep the excellent health insurance coverage I got as a result of my brief stint at Middlebury College---if I can afford to pay the monthly COBRA premiums. 

They're pretty expensive:

As you can see, I've already paid the first premium, which means I am covered through 7/31/12:

 

My wife gets cheap health insurance through her job, but the coverage is not adequate to provide for my more elaborate medical needs. The CBA Blue plan from Middlebury, on the other hand, is. This is why I need to hang onto it---even for just a little bit longer.

Keeping this specific insurance will allow me:

  • To continue getting the annual MRIs that my neurologist needs to monitor my disease.
  • To continue seeking preventive and maintenance care where appropriate by visiting my primary care physician and/or any necessary specialists.
  • To continue seeing my neurologist every 3-4 months as recommended.
  • To obtain routine bloodwork needed to monitor my liver function and white/red blood cell counts (as the MS med I take can cause problems with both of these).
  • To obtain "acute" care (high doses of IV methylprednisolone) if necessary, i.e. - should I have an MS relapse. Getting acute care during an MS relapse or "flare-up" is very important, as it can potentially help reduce long-term, permanent disability.

AND, MOST IMPORTANTLY OF ALL:

  • To continue to have access to Rebif---a very, very expensive immunomodulatory drug that has allowed me to keep my MS in remission since June 2009. 

Please note that I am not asking for a "free ride." I paid the first COBRA premium last month, and I have managed to save enough to make the next payment of $622.02 that is due on August 1, 2012. [UPDATE: I made the COBRA payment that was due on August 1st on 7/31/12. Please see the "Updates" tab of this campaign page for screen shots, etc.]

Even if I can raise the money to keep my CBA Blue insurance through COBRA on a more long-term basis---legally I am allowed to hang onto it for up to 18 months---I will still have to pay co-pays for all of my doctor's visits, lab work, medications, and so on. These co-pays alone add up to several hundred dollars per month. The funds I am trying to raise here will give me access to great insurance for hopefully another year or so. I am more than willing to do the rest on my own.

If I don't reach my full goal, any funds raised will go towards the cost of premiums for COBRA. On the first of each month, I owe CBA Blue $622.02, and if I do not pay I will lose my coverage.

The Impact:

If I can retain my insurance, stay healthy, and focus on teaching and finishing my dissertation during the 2012-2013 academic year, it won't just represent the fulfillment of a lifelong dream for me. I truly believe that the work I do makes a positive impact on the world. Whether through my teaching or research, I believe that I have something meaningful to contribute to the planet. 

I've made it this far and I'm not a quitter. I just need a little help during this last year of my PhD. I'd love to finish this degree and go on to build my career so that I can continue to have a positive impact on many, many classrooms of students to come. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you are unable to donate, please spread the word. Maybe you know someone who is able. Thank you.

My dissertation examines representations and the aesthetics of disability in Brazilian literature.
In the recent past, I worked as a Research Assistant and instructor of Portuguese at UMass Dartmouth and as a Lecturer of Portugese at UMass Boston (where I expect to be teaching again during academic year 2012-2013). 
Last year---academic year 2011-2012---I was employed as a visiting instructor at Middlebury College in Vermont [LINK OPENS TO .PDF].
If you want, you can see even more about my professional development and just some of my activities as a scholar by going here, here, here and here.
My wife Amanda works at a Starbucks in Boston, where she is a kick-ass barista but, like me, does not make very much money.
Right now, we're stressing over $7464.00. That's the amount standing between us and my lifelong dream. 


I <3 COBRA 4-Eva:
So what do I need? I need exactly $7464.00. What does this amount pay for? It pays for my COBRA premiums for 12 months. I'm lucky enough to have the opportunity to keep the excellent health insurance coverage I got as a result of my brief stint at Middlebury College---if I can afford to pay the monthly COBRA premiums. 
They're pretty expensive:

As you can see, I've already paid the first premium, which means I am covered through 7/31/12:

 
My wife gets cheap health insurance through her job, but the coverage is not adequate to provide for my more elaborate medical needs. The CBA Blue plan from Middlebury, on the other hand, is. This is why I need to hang onto it---even for just a little bit longer.
Keeping this specific insurance will allow me:

To continue getting the annual MRIs that my neurologist needs to monitor my disease.
To continue seeking preventive and maintenance care where appropriate by visiting my primary care physician and/or any necessary specialists.
To continue seeing my neurologist every 3-4 months as recommended.
To obtain routine bloodwork needed to monitor my liver function and white/red blood cell counts (as the MS med I take can cause problems with both of these).
To obtain "acute" care (high doses of IV methylprednisolone) if necessary, i.e. - should I have an MS relapse. Getting acute care during an MS relapse or "flare-up" is very important, as it can potentially help reduce long-term, permanent disability.

AND, MOST IMPORTANTLY OF ALL:

To continue to have access to Rebif---a very, very expensive immunomodulatory drug that has allowed me to keep my MS in remission since June 2009. 

Please note that I am not asking for a "free ride." I paid the first COBRA premium last month, and I have managed to save enough to make the next payment of $622.02 that is due on August 1, 2012. [UPDATE: I made the COBRA payment that was due on August 1st on 7/31/12. Please see the "Updates" tab of this campaign page for screen shots, etc.]
Even if I can raise the money to keep my CBA Blue insurance through COBRA on a more long-term basis---legally I am allowed to hang onto it for up to 18 months---I will still have to pay co-pays for all of my doctor's visits, lab work, medications, and so on. These co-pays alone add up to several hundred dollars per month. The funds I am trying to raise here will give me access to great insurance for hopefully another year or so. I am more than willing to do the rest on my own.
If I don't reach my full goal, any funds raised will go towards the cost of premiums for COBRA. On the first of each month, I owe CBA Blue $622.02, and if I do not pay I will lose my coverage.


The Impact:
If I can retain my insurance, stay healthy, and focus on teaching and finishing my dissertation during the 2012-2013 academic year, it won't just represent the fulfillment of a lifelong dream for me. I truly believe that the work I do makes a positive impact on the world. Whether through my teaching or research, I believe that I have something meaningful to contribute to the planet. 
I've made it this far and I'm not a quitter. I just need a little help during this last year of my PhD. I'd love to finish this degree and go on to build my career so that I can continue to have a positive impact on many, many classrooms of students to come. 
Other Ways You Can Help:


If you are unable to donate, please spread the word. Maybe you know someone who is able. Thank you.

story:
I would like to ask you to participate in an exciting opportunity which will assist me in funding my future film projects and non-profit organization.

THE CURRENT SITUATION

One of the major issues in the film industry is securing funding for proposed film projects that can translate into a major channel for future funding. Not only are film projects in jeopardy but also all projects that help support the arts and entertainment.

Therefore, new approaches must be created and developed to express my creativity and to pursue the funds to fulfill my dream of being a major contributor to the growing and competitive film industry.

MY APPROACH TO THE SITUATION

A  36 hour Certificate Program in Proposal Writing at Rollins College, Winter Park, FL.  http://pnlc.rollins.edu/?page=cert_proposal

This program, at a cost of $1500, offers the tools to develop carefully targeted, well-written proposals that make a compelling case to achieve my efforts in securing funding for future film projects.  But moreover, this venture will allow me to establish a means to give back to my community.  It will allow me to assist fine arts organizations and nonprofit agencies.  Also, it will allow me to establish educational and developmental programs, workshops, and conferences for underrepresented individuals and at risk youth to participate in a process which will give them insight into the vast film industry.  

To become a self sustaining entity, I am soliciting donations from friends and supporters who believe in my craft.  Your interest in this endeavor is greatly appreciated.  I only hope my request falls within the priorities of you supporting my efforts of film making.  I look forward hearing from you and you being a part of my Jouney. 

Thank you for your consideration and willingness to support my endeavors.  But moreover, thank you for believing in me.

story:
Intro

Hello, my friends! My name is J.T. Shields and I come to you in need of some help. But before we get to why I need help, let me give you some background as to why I am even asking in the first place.

Background

Let me backup 5 years. Young J.T. graduates from high school in Enid, Oklahoma intent on going to the local college in town to get his basics. His naive mentality pushes him to strive for an English degree so he can pursue a career in writing poems and science fiction.

Two years later, J.T. drops out of college because he is still in the high school "naive" mentality and proceeds to slave away from dead end job to dead end job to somehow payoff the $13,000 student loan he has no way of paying off.

But look! Hope!

I've always felt a need to serve this country, and the Marine Corps is the pride of this nation. So, on a whim, I walk into the recruiter's station and talk to them about enlisting. And, let me tell you, the picture they painted was beautiful....

"You want pride? America LOVES the Marines! You have a weak body? After 4 months in you'll have a Spartan body! You want drive to do anything? You'll have so much courage you'll think climbing Mt. Everest was easy! You have student loans? We'll pay them off for you! Truck held together by duct tape? Since we pay for everything, your paycheck goes straight to you! Buy yourself a sports car!"

I don't remember if it was the motivation to serve and to be a badass that caused me to enlist, or if it was the shear fact I had no other options. But I signed those papers quicker than they could hand them to me.

I went to boot camp Valentine's Day of 2011.

Did I get pride? Tons. Did I get drive? Absolutely. Did I get a Spartan body? Heck yeah.  

Did I get my student loans paid off? No. Did I get that sports car? I got a toy car of one...

I returned home in April to Enid after 8 months of comm school at MCAGCC 29 Palms, California, training to be a "Telephone and Computer Repairer". I'm a reservist and I was ready to re-enter civilian with gratutious amounts of motivation. And boy, did I have a plan. I was going to move to the big city, get a job as an IT technician at a big name company, pay off my student loans, get a car and apartment and live the high life.

That was 4 months ago. Life smacked me in the face. Again.

Three months of looking and still no company would hire a tech without proper schooling. My money slowly dried up. My mother broke her back causing me to stay in town to look after her.

But hope is still not lost...

I've enrolled in a vocational school here in town to continue my IT training and to get some computer certifications. I've taken a part-time job as a stocker at a grocery store. My mother is healing. I'm ready to move forward.

And this is where you come in.

The $20,000 i'm asking for is to help me get back on my feet. I have the drive, but not the means. With this money, you can help me get debt free and on track to a good career. 

What Exactly Am I Going To Do?

Here's exactly where this $20,000 is going to go:

  • $13,000 - Pay off student loans. The company they're through is breathing down my neck.
  • $2,000 - Paying for vocational school. My G.I. Bill just does not cover very much of this.
  • $3,000 - Buy a car. Driving the old family truck is killing me with gas money. 
  • $2000 - Finding a place to live/living expenses. This is going to be used to find me a place to live and as a base to start saving money.

As for perks, there really is no way with this to give any sustantial incentive aside from my absolute gratitude towards you. But, I've come up with three that you might enjoy, and I will post more if you give me good ideas for more.

The Future

My plans for after becoming free of debt and after finishing school vary. My ideas for the moment is finding a steady job here in town and saving money. From there, hopefully I can finish college and finally get out of Enid and even out of Oklahoma (I hear Colorado is nice). I love computers, and I've always been a nerd. I hope someday I can find a job where I can be nerdy all the time.

But even with my future plans still a long ways away, please know that you are helping me immensely. And I am eternally grateful to you. Even just taking the time to read my story gives me motivation to continue on.

I also want to point out that if you decide not to help me, that is perfectly fine. But I encourage you to support your troops in any way you can. There are many of my brothers out there, some with worse stories than mine, that can use your help. I hope you reach out to them. 

Thank you and Semper Fidelis,

J.T. Shields

story:
Fallen Officers in St. John Parish 

On the morning of August 16, two St. John Parish Sheriff's Deputies Brandon Nielsen and Jeremy Triche, were tragically shot and killed in the line of duty.  Two other officers, Michael "Scott" Boyington and Jason Triche, were severely wounded and are in critical care.  As all Officers do, these guys put their lives on the line every day to protect and serve our communities.  One can’t imagine the pain that these Officers families, friends, and co-workers are feeling at the moment and for the time to come. 

 

Please join us in showing your support for the ultimate sacrifices that these Officers have made for their communities.  This campaign is to raise money for the surviving families.  We will coninue to provide more detailed information on the Officers as time goes on. 

 

Deputy Jeremy Triche had been with the St John Sheriff's Office for four years and was currently assigned to the Canine Division.  He is survived by his wife and two year old son.

 

Deputy Brandon Nielsen had been with the St John Sheriff's Office for the past 1.8 years and was assigned to the traffic division.  He is survived by his wife and five children.

 

Thank you for your Support.

Thank you for your Support.

story:
I love to read. I read hundreds of books a year.  In my neighborhood, I need to have someone drive me to the nearest library and bookstores because it’s too far and the roads are too dangerous.

I believe that we need a book exchange that kids and adults can walk or bike to. Quam Park is the perfect place to host a Little Free Library.

What is a Little Free Library?
Little Free Libraries are little shelters that house books. They are a place to exchange books, explore interests and share the joy of reading. Little Free Libraries promote literacy while recycling books.

Take a Book – Return a Book
Little Free Libraries are supported by the communities they are in. If you have a good book that you are done reading and would like to share, drop it off. If you need a new book to read, stop by and take one that looks interesting. And, don’t forget to return it so the next person can read it! Enjoy your new book on the nearby park bench or take it home. Read it alone or share it with a friend. See, isn’t reading fun?

Who is this for?
The entire community. The Quam Park Little Free Library will have books for big kids, little kids, adults, cooks, handymen, adventurers, friends . . . everyone is welcome to take part.

Official Support
On September 4, 2012, I made a presentation to the Pleasant Springs Town Board about my idea. They gave me permission to put a Little Free Library in Quam Park so everyone can enjoy it. They even offered to help with the installation! We’re working with www.LittleFreeLibrary.org, too.

Now what I need is help raising money to pay for it.
I need to raise at least $500 to purchase the weather resistant shelter and install it. I'm also collecting donated books. Any additional money will be used to buy new books for the library. Can I count on you? Please?

There are several ways you can help . . .

  1. Financially support the purchase of the Little Free Library by donating* money. I even have some special perks for people who help fund this library. Please select a donation amount>>>>>
  2. Visit our online shop at www.cafepress.com/QuamLibrary There you can buy really cool mugs, t-shirts, book bags and more with our logo on it. With each purchase, $1-3 dollars will go toward supporting the Library.
  3. Spread the word. Talk to neighbors, family and friends. Tell them about our fundraising efforts, even send them a link. Ask them to help. Like us on Facebook. And, mark our campaign as a Favorite.
  4. After it’s installed [we hope in late October 2012], visit the library. Take a book. Read a Book. Return a Book.

Become a donor and I’ll even send you an invitation to our ribbon cutting!

Thank you for your support!
Xoxo Veronica

++++++++++++++++++++++++++

*Small print: Thank you for considering a gift to the community by helping fund the Quam Park Little Free Library. Unfortunately, money given to this community effort is not tax deductible.

Where is Quam Park?
Quam Park is in the Town of Pleasant Springs Here’s a google map. http://bit.ly/QuamPark

story:
If I were a fat kid, film would be my cake. That's how much I love being an actress and a filmmaker.


After graduating from Howard University in May as a Theatre Arts Major, I auditioned for Central's "Acting for Screen" Master's program hosted in New York City. After an exhausting but exciting day and an agonizing month later, I finally recieved the news that I had been accepted into the program.


Needless to say, I am SOOOOOOO excited to be joining the 2013 class of Central School of Speech and Drama in LONDON, ENGLAND!


That being said, we all know the U.S. dollar is toilet paper right now. And at the moment, I can't even afford to wipe my behind.


My mother has been SUCH a blessing in helping me to get tuition for Central which translates to around $25,000+. However...


In order to obtain a VISA to live in England for a year, I must be able to prove that I can sustain living in the country financially. I, personally, have nothing against sidewalk cardboard houses...however, government officials don't necessarily agree with me.


I am definitely going to London. I am convinced it is in my cards. However, I would love not to be an illegal alien/fugitive doing it. That's where you come in...


I NEED YOUR HELP!!! Tuition for Central is due in early September. I must apply for my Visa around Mid-August and prove that I have enough money to be cleared. The amount necessary: $10,000 est. I'm asking for your help to raise half ($5,000).


ANYTHING is helpful. So please pass the word and support. One day, I'll be bringing you Oscar-winning movies.... but today, I'm just a kid tryna get her studies on. :)

story:
Sutmae Pawb! Hello everybody!

The Celtic nations of Scotland and Ireland are well known to many people in the United States but it's Celtic cousin - Wales is only now becoming more known. Which is surprising as many famous Americans including Abraham Lincoln, Thomas Jefferson, Bob Hope and Tom Cruise have Welsh heritage. Well we want to bring more awareness of Wales and the Welsh Language and  Culture to Los Angeles in 2013 at the St. Davids Festival in the Barnsdall arts park in Hollywood.

I'm Jason Shepherd the host of the Learn Welsh Podcast. Every week I teach the Welsh Language in 15 to 20 minute podcast episodes for anyone who is interested in Learning the Welsh Language. Last year I was invited to the West Coast Eisteddfod in Los Angeles to teach a series of Welsh Lessons at the first Welsh Festival in Los Angeles for many years. It was a great festival and 1000's of people came. I taught a series of Welsh lessons over two days and they were a great success i'm glad to say. So much so that I was invited back in 2013.

This time the festival will be on the week of St. David's Day. The problem is that the money the festival organizers had to pay for my trip from Wales to Los Angeles, so that I can once again teach Welsh at the Festival has fallen through. So the only way we could think of making sure Welsh is taught at the festival in 2013 is to start a fundraiser.

If you would like to support or are going to the Festival once again at the Barnsdell Arts Park in Hollywood and would like to Learn more Welsh, then any money you are able to pledge towards this project would be gratefully received. Here are some of the great Perks you can get in return for pledging money for this project.

I want to bring the Welsh Language to Los Angeles and by taking part in this fundraiser you can help me to do that.

I want to thank you for your support of this project.

Diolch yn Fawr! Thank you very much!

Jason Shepherd

story:
The Bear Facts

Teddy Sitter is a fun and interactive educational plush toy for children aged four to eight.  He knows jokes, stories, games, plays music and a lot more !

He enables parents to check on their children’s well-being and surroundings remotely using a mobile application. Teddy comes with basic content and gives parents the option of purchasing supplementary content, through his mobile application.

 Our Prototype :

Teddy Sitter plays with children

  • Teddy Sitter calls your child by name
  • Teddy Sitter is a nightlight
  • Teddy Sitter tells bedtime stories
  • Teddy Sitter tells jokes
  • Teddy Sitter sings songs
  • Teddy Sitter can play MP3s (via "airplay-like" or via it's own library)
  • Teddy Sitter knows educational songs
  • Teddy Sitter knows educational games
  • Teddy Sitter passes on messages from parents to kids
  • Teddy Sitter can set his alarm clock
  • Teddy Sitter whispers in the dark
  • Teddy Sitter likes to be hugged and says so
  • Teddy Sitter like to be treated right

 

Teddy Sitter talks to parents

Teddy Sitter is linked to a mobile application that enables him to facilitate communication between a child and his parents:

  • Teddy Sitter can take a room temperature reading
  • Teddy Sitter can measure the room humidity
  • Teddy Sitter can take pictures and send them to parents
  • Teddy Sitter has pre-programmed reminders for the child (time to shower, have a snack, bundle up, take medication, etc.)
  • Teddy Sitter monitors the child’s sleeping patterns and informs parents
  • Teddy Sitter can send messages to the parents and to the children via the mobile application

 

Delivery date: December 2013

Approximate size: 30 cm (the prototype is around 50cm)

 Languages : French and English


Teddy Sitter understands, for real

Teddy Sitter understands multiple ways of saying things:

  • At bedtime, if the child says, “I don’t want to go to sleep, I’m scared,” Teddy switches on his night-light and sings a nursery rhyme
  • If the child says, “I want my Mommy,” the mobile app tells the mother, “Your child needs you”
  • The mother can ask Teddy to relay the message “Mommy will be home soon” with an approximate time
  • If the child says “I’m bored,” Teddy suggests a game to play
  • If the child says, “Play music,” Teddy can play him a song he knows or an MP3 downloaded by the parents
  • If the child wants to hear a bedtime story, Teddy tells one from his catalog

 

Teddy understands 50 common phrases and their related variants and we're still adding some.

Teddy will come delivered with a basic package of:

  • 10 children's short stories
  • 10 full-length stories
  • 20 jokes
  • 5 types of educational games
  • 5 bedtime nursery rhymes
  • 5 educational nursery rhymes

 

FINAL DESIGN

Teddy Sitter Store: content and functionalities

Teddy’s functionality can be enriched. The mobile application lets parents buy:

Content like games, songs, stories, educational songs, jokes, etc.
The price will be comparable to pricing on stores like iTunes.

Applications to be released via an SDK that will be made available to developers
The price will be comparable to pricing on stores like iTunes.

 

What we need

For the moment, Teddy Sitter is merely a prototype. We need funding to create a manufacturable prototype and order the first units.

The funds will be used to:
- Perform an architectural study
       Build a microcontroller card
       Draft a functional model and 3D rendering

- Prepare for commercial manufacturing
       Acquire certification

- Market and sell
       Produce the packaging
       User manuals
       Design the final mobile application
       Build the website
       Create/buy content

Impact: give your child the best friend we all dreamed of as kids and the nanny all parents dream of
Give your child a special friend and monitor his or her well-being at all times. Teddy Sitter is not just a plush toy. He’s the best friend of kids and parents. He can undergo unlimited updates to improve his comprehension and speaking skills. He can receive unlimited upgrades with the purchase of content and applications.

Everything he needs to receive upgrades is already built in.

This is the “living” plush toy we all dreamed of as kids, and the one we’re dreaming of for our own kids.

 

find out more on Facebook : http://www.facebook.com/teddysitter

 

The Team

Thierry Verrecchia
The Computer Science Engineer
Thierry is the founder of the web agency he’s overseen for the last 10 years. He brings product ideas to W4C, as well as technical solutions on a daily basis.

Nicolas Sosnowiez
The Communicator
Journalist, blogger and marketing pro for close to 10 years, Nicolas brings to W4C his product ideas and expertise in marketing communication.

Alain Maucourt
The Electronics Engineer
Formerly head of production at LaCie, Alain brings to W4C his expertise in electronics, electrical engineering and mechanical engineering. He brings ideas to life by creating the first prototypes.

Nicolas Simier
The Tech Guru
A developer who has worked for Thierry’s web agency for the last six years, Nicolas enables objects to be configured and communicate with the web, nothing is impossible for him !

story:
Short Summary

We are Matt and Josh. Ever since we ended up in the same political science department at Wheaton College, we've been passionate about political & economic theory as it relates to reformed theology. So, a few weeks ago, we submitted a proposal to give a paper on those very topics. And we got accepted!

There's just one problem.

THE NETHERLANDS IS OVER 4,000 MILES AWAY! 

And we are very poor. That is why we are asking YOU, our friends and family, to help us out. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our trip will cost $2,200 for transportation, and $300 for lodging and food, bringing the total to $2,500. 

$1,000 has already been committed. 

If 2 people give $15 every day until January 8th (the conference date) we will reach our goal!

By donating, you will get the satisfaction of supporting two young scholars.

Your investment will improve our prospects for graduate school and future careers.

You will also get a sincere thank-you letter, and an exclusive look at our paper if you ask. 

Fixing the Economy

Your donation will help us solve the economic crisis. (Or at least learn from it!)

The conference is titled "Economics, Christianity & The Crisis: Towards a New Architectonic Critique." The purpose is to critically analyse of the economic crisis and it's underlying theories from a the perspective of Kuyperian thought. You can read more about it here: http://www.wijsbegeerte.vu.nl/en/news-events/events/2013/amsterdam-kuyper-seminar.asp 

If you would like to hear more about our paper and the conference, you can email us at Matt.Josh.Amsterdam@gmail.com 

About Us

Matthew Arildsen is a Senior at Wheaton College, studying Philosophy, Economics and Political Science. He works as a Research Assistent for the Political Science Department Chair, doing research on Religion and the Tea Party for the Midwest Political Science Association. In his spare time, Matt enjoys arguing and sitting in hot tubs. 

Joshua Little is a 2012 graduate of Wheaton College, with a major in Political Science and a minor in Biblical & Theological Studies. He also enjoys new media & journalism. He now works in nonprofit. Josh enjoys running and reading in his spare time. 

Please Share this page with your friends! Use the Indiegogo Share tools to post on social media. 

THANK YOU!

story:
In a Nutshell...

As a longtime socially engaged Buddhist, I am very excited about this opportunity to contribute to the Buddhist Education for Social Transformation (BEST) project.

BEST supports Asian activists and social change movements to apply Buddhist principles of nonviolence to their work.

I've been invited by program founders Ouyporn Khuankaew and Ginger Norwood to be on the faculty for the inaugural training session, happening this July in Thailand.

BEST has limited funding which is prioritized for supporting program participants, who are activists from marginalized groups in Asia. I don't have enough resources to make this trip on my own, so I am asking your help to cover transportation to Thailand so that I may support this program and teach a workshop on "The Mandala of Socially Engaged Buddhism."

 

What I Need & What You Get

I need to raise $2100 to cover my airfare from Albuquerque, NM, to Chiang Mai, Thailand, this July. This amount needs to be raised by May 1, 2013.

In return for your support, I'm offering some wonderful thank-you gifts: 

  • Every gift of $25 and more will receive a thank-you postcard with a beautiful photo of Thailand
  • Every gift of $100 and more will receive a Thai textile 
  • Every gift of $500 and more will receive a special small Buddha statute from Thailand
  • All gifts are deeply appreciated and much-needed!

This is a "fixed funding" campaign, which means that if we don't reach $2100, I won't get any of the money. I would so much appreciate your help to meet this goal!

 

A Bit More About the BEST Project and Me

The Buddhist Education for Social Transformation (BEST) course is an innovative yearlong certificated course focused on transformation of individuals, communities, the environment, and the world. The program is open to anyone seeking a Buddhist perspective in his or her approach to personal development, social justice, and social change work. 

The program is organized by International Women’s Partnership for Peace and Justice (IWP), based in Chiang Mai, Thailand and builds on IWP's experience working with social change agents from the grassroots to the government levels over the past 15 years.

The course is founded on the pillars of non-violent activism, spiritual practice, and anti-oppression feminism. The course is intended to support participants’ integration of spiritual practice and social action, grounded in structural analysis and an understanding of the interdependence of personal transformation and structural change.

 

And who am I? My name is Maia Duerr, and I've been studying and practicing Buddhism since 1994. In 1999, I began working for the Buddhist Peace Fellowship, an organization dedicated to addressing peace and social justice issues from a Buddhist perspective. For three years, I was the associate editor of BPF's magazine, Turning Wheel. From 2004 - 2007, I served as BPF's executive director. 

I have been writing and teaching about socially engaged Buddhism for a number of years now -- you can read my work on The Jizo Chronicles as well as The Liberated Life Project. Currently, I direct Upaya Zen Center's Buddhist Chaplaincy Program. 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help me by sharing this campaign on your Facebook page and other social media accounts. Thanks!

story:
Something truly magical is happening right now. I'm glad that you have found this site and I'm glad that you will be a part of a very memorable birthday.

If you are reading this right now then that means that you know and love Morton Bergue. It goes without saying that you are not alone and that is what makes this project so incredibly exciting.

For 50 years Morton has had a way of making us all feel that we are his best friend. He has counseled us. He has laughed and cried with us. He has gone out of his way to help us succeed. He has been the true definition of friend. All of us have benefited from his unconditional love and optimistic view on life. He is that truly unique individual that makes YOU better for knowing him. 

Morton is turning 50 this year and we would like to do something simply incredible. Maybe something that has never been done before.

For Morton's 50th Birthday we want to literally pay him back. Pay him back for the priceless ways he has touched all of our lives. How incredible would this be? Thousands and thousands of individuals have been touched by Morton. What if they all came together to pay him back at the same time?

It would be like winning the lottery!

In addition to contributing to Morton's Lottery win, please take a moment to leave Morton a Voicemail Birthday greeting. It's simple.

Call 1-877-OurQuilt (1-877-687-7845)
(see http://voicequilt.com/overseas if calling from outside the US)

When asked for your invitation number, enter 191076

Record your message, just as if you were leaving a voicemail
Press # to review your message – or just hang up to save it.

For message ideas, see the Thought Starters at http://voicequilt.com/inspireme

Heart Cyprus is a top destination branding project for Cyprus. The aim is to promote Cyprus all over the world. 

The funds raised from this campaign will be used for the creation of a 100 pages Limited edition book with the top 100 words from the Cypriot dialect. 

A must have book, for everyone who loves Cyprus.

Choose one of the Perks on the right and Buy your Book Now.

​Our dialect is extraordinary. We should all try to preserve and promote it! We really expect that you will support our efforts to spread the word about our island's unique language!

story:
Bursting at the Seams in Lot 32

In November of 2012, The Intersection of Owosso purchased a trailer on Lot 32 in Pleasant Valley Mobile Home Park. This came after several months of building trust and friendships with residents who live in the park. It became apparent that the best way to reduce isolation from resources and opportunities and to build real friendships across socio-economic barriers was to actually move into the neighborhood.

Over the past three years, Lot 32 has been the home of transformational change. In collaboration with other community organizations we have hosted play groups, substance abuse support groups, employment counseling, cooking classes, scouting groups, and more. We have also been an important link between the neighborhood and basic living resources throughout the community. We have built a stronger sense of community through neighborhood block parties, cook outs, and shared holiday meals. Literally hundreds of people have made life-changing connections inside the walls of Lot 32.

The results have been reported not only inside the Pleasant Valley community, but from the broader community as well. Law enforcement reported a 20% decrease in phone calls, service agencies and schools report more trust and cooperation with care plans, volunteers who come to the community notice a more positive and hopeful environment.

All of this activity has taken its toll on our humble little building which we purchased for a price of $800. We have filled that little trailer to capacity so many times that it is literally bursting at the seams. We have big dreams for the future but in order to maintain our current programming and build toward the future, we need to replace our building before the snow flies.

You can help us continue to live life hand-in-hand with our Pleasant Valley neighbors by making a contribution today to help us reach our goal of $2000. Thank you for your past and continued support of this work.

- Marlene Webster, Executive Director

Body regeneration in 27 days due to the unique ingredients from Siberia!

Blossomsib is a unique multifunctional product for the health of mind and body!

                      

It starts deep processes which improve your health, strengthen your immunity and restore the body at the cellular level. At the same time slow the aging process prolonging youth.

Blossomsib Concentrate is a natural protection against the effects of the urban environment and urban life.


HOW BLOSSOMSIB WOKS?

1.  Does not mask, but restores!

         

Activating the transport of nutrients stimulates the production of new collagen; NOT forced but NATURAL as it usually comes from within the skin.

     

2.  Normalizes and renews!

Any imbalance of minerals in the body leads to a violation of mineral metabolism that has a consequence. This leads to a severe pathological phenomena.

Blossomsib restores the body at the cellular level and normalizes all biological processes allowing people to be active and attractive.

3.  Detoxifies!

We are exposed to various types of radiation all the time, from natural and man-made sources: mobile phones, computers etc. We can protect ourselves from these exposures.

The zeolite was used in Chernobyl and Fukushima after the accidents  at nuclear power plants.

Blossomsib takes effective steps to protect your health from radiation and make your life longer!

4.  Nice additions!


Can it benefit the body in so many ways?

YES

By removing the toxins which impede metabolic processes including healing, Blossomsib allows the body to achieve a state in which it can heal itself much more effectively. Many of the benefits are downstream consequences of its primary abilities to detoxify the body and systematically balance body pH levels.


IT HAS 4 MAIN INGREDIENTS

In the world there are several deposits of zeolite, but the only deposit of zeolite suitable for use in the nutrition is in Siberia!


Perks

                 

Retail price of one bottle is 5000 RUB ≈100$ .

 100 First Buyers have a chance to buy  2 bottles with 35% off; 3, 6, 9 and 12 bottles with 45 % off .


Then you can buy Blossomsib for:
2 bottles = 121 $
3 bottles = 153$
6 bottles = 306$
9 bottles = 459$
12 bottles = 611$


SHIPPING TIMELINE

You will get your order in 35 days after the end of campaign.

HOW TO USE?

After opening the bottle, the product should be consumed within a month!!!

WHY LIQUID BETTER THAN TABLETS?

THE BASIS OF Blossomsib IS WATER ENRICHED BY FILTRATION THROUGH SEMI-PRECIOUS STONES WITH ADDITIONS OF SILICON AND OXYGEN

Exclusive and unique manufacturing technology of Blossomsib allows not only to maintain the highest value of each ingredient, but also to balance different components to achieve the best effect.

Every-day “TEST DRIVE”

Especially for You we decided to make an incredible “TEST DRIVE” of concentrate Blossomsib with daily independent reports from our “test drivers” about the impact of Blossomsib on their WELL-BEING, HEALTH and LIFE. All reports will be posted on their personal Facebook pages (if he/she has it) and here: https://www.facebook.com/blossomsib.

So, our “test drivers” are:

Ksenya Sobchak, 33, Moscow, a Russian TV anchor, journalist, socialite, and member of political opposition

A few weeks ago I told you about the gift, which I got from blossomsib.com. I am skeptical about unfamiliar products, but it was recommended by people I trust - natural ingredients, no chemicals or side effects. I took almost the entire course and I feel the extraordinary ease. I feel that the body is completely renewed. Blossomsib really works. Well done guys from Siberia!

"... DARK CIRCLES UNDER MY EYES HAVE COMPLETELY DISAPPEARED..."

Pauline, 32, Novosibirsk

As of today, I have taken a half of the course and a break for 3 days. Positive moments are: the dream has become deeper; I am getting enough sleep for a short period of time; dark circles under my eyes have completely disappeared that makes me very happy!. My skin has become fresher. I feel a surge of strength and the improvement in mood, regardless of the weather. I do not take any vitamins and medicines and I did not change my makeup, so, I associate the effect only with the use of BLOSSOMSIB. No negative moments have been observed, neither bad reaction of the gastrointestinal tract, nor allergic reactions. I will definitely continue the course! And good luck to the developers of the product! Definitely recommend Blossomsib!

“… MIGRAINES AND Blossomsib”

Boris, 63, Novosibirsk

My migraine didn't go away for a single moment; sometimes it "walked" quietly, but sometimes I had strong pain attacks that it was impossible to lie down, sit or stand. I managed to remove the pain by potent drugs that were accumulated in the body and resulted to problems with kidneys, liver, and stomach. I was offered to use the BLOSSOMSIB drink twice a day before meals when I felt the symptoms again. The migraine have "walked" for a long time, but attacks did not occur. There was no need to take medicines, but I still kept them in a pocket. For me it was already a victory. The autumn passed without attacks, although inner the restlessness did not go away. I did not notice when my migraines stopped “walking”. Suddenly, it became easier to live! BLOSSOMSIB has changed my life! I have not only got rid of the excruciating pain attacks, but also have given up smoking without the use of any kind of help. Now there are no pills in my pocket, but BLOSSOMSIB is always on my table.

BLOSSOMSIB Team


WHY INDIEGOGO

For the past several months we have been hard at work developing Blossomsib, with the goal of bringing better health to every person in the world and we understand how important this is to get it right. We have built our methods of manufacturing and distributing the product. We now need your help to innovate even faster and take Blossomsib to the next level - international.

Our vision is to help every person on the planet to live longer and healthier. We want to share our Blossomsib product and its story with all of you. Please help us to improve people's lives and their health through being the some of the first to purchase this product. We want to help people live better lives and this is of the utmost importance to us.

The funds we raise during our campaign will allow us to develop markets such as the Americas, Europe and Asia and develop the logistical systems in these areas as well. This is essential for growing the market to be made available to everyone!

So please back Blossomsib today and turn your dreams of a longer, healthier life into a reality!

Where do the funds go?


Risks & Challenges

We have already successfully produced 1500 bottles of Blossomsib in mass production scenarios, so we are confident in our manufacturing capabilities.

We are well versed in the challenges involved in delivery, especially in Russia, so you can have confidence in us that we will do our best to ensure your purchase arrives on time and in mint condition.

FAQ

1. Blossomsib seems too good to be true. How can it benefit the body in so many ways?
This is a common reaction to this product and often asked. By removing the toxins which impede metabolic processes including healing, Blossomsib allows the body to achieve a state in which it can heal itself much more effectively. Many of the benefits are downstream consequences of its primary abilities to detoxify the body and balance the body's pH levels.

2. Can Blossomsib create any allergy reactions?
No, however, please review the components on the product label if you do have allergies.

3. Can Blossomsib be used when you are feeding or pregnant?
Yes, you can

4. If I take Blossomsib to restore or maintain my health, do I need to do anything else?

Blossomsib is NOT a magic potion and we are not marketing it as such. But it is a supplement that can be used in helping you maintain or improve your health.

5. How long does Blossomsib remain in the body?

It stays in the body about 24 hours before it is 100% eliminated.

6. Can I take too much Blossomsib?
No, Blossomsib is very safe and non-toxic.

7. Should Blossomsib be taken with food or on an empty stomach?

It works both ways without causing any side effects, such as a upset stomach. However, it is best taken in an eight-ounce glass of water to help insure adequate hydration throughout the day.

8. Why is detoxification of the body important?

The average person is exposed to more toxins through water and air pollution, household cleaning supplies, pesticides, disinfectants, and food additives more than ever before in human history. These toxins are strongly correlated with the occurrence of a wide range of ailments, including disease, cancers, birth defects, and neurological disorders such as Alzheimer’s, autism, and dementia. In the world we live in today, detoxification is becoming more essential to prevent disease and create optimal health.

9. What does it mean that Blossomsib balances the body’s pH level?

Blossomsib as a solution, is a negatively charged molecule with a cage-like structure that is able to trap positively charged hydronium ions. These ions, when captured, lower the pH in the body. By eliminating them, Blossomsib helps balance the pH to a more neutral, alkaline level, and take the burden off the body’s systems that work hard to keep pH stable and healthy.

10.  Why is it important to maintain proper pH balance?
Because bad bacteria, fungi, yeast, and viruses—as well as diseases such as cancer – thrive in an a more acidic environment, however pH levels of 7.3 and below can be conducive to disease as well. The optimum pH of your body should be slightly alkaline – between 7.35 and 7.45 which is the level that Blossomsib tends to help establish.

story:
Bullying is a problem that far too many children and teens experience. Many in our communities struggle to figure out the best way to help. 

Two years ago Prairie Public created Stand Up ND to raise awareness about bullying and ways to reduce it. The video for this campaign shows Prairie Public's call for school projects about kindness. Now the torch for Stand Up ND is being passed on to Northern Lights Youth Services. NLYS is the perfect organization to adopt this project. The organization oversees SADD (Students Against Destructive Decisions) organizations in ND, MN and SD. The project will now reach students and educators more directly in their schools.

Your contribution of any amount will fund stipends for the time and effort it takes to update the project's social media and website. The project's Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and Pinterest provide a rich offering of articles, videos, book picks and strategies for addressing bullying. Children, parents, educators and others can also share ideas and their experiences of standing up for themselves and others. Your contribution will sustain this steady stream of information and will allow for the creation of much new content by children and teens for the benefit of all. 

We have decided that all funds raised will go into sustaining this effort. We will not be printing t-shirts or coffee mugs. We hope you understand and agree that what matters most is putting the funds raised into the work they are intended for. Your contribution of any amount is appreciated and is tax deductible.

Lastly we hope you will share this link with all your friends and followers. No campaign can be truly successful without the help of everyone involved. Thank you for any help you can offer.

No campaign can be truly successful without the help of everyone involved. Thank you for any help you can offer.

story:
The short version: I need money to attend grad school. You should really read the long version though.  If you cannot contribute financially, please contribute by sharing this campaign!

 

This is the long version....

 

My name is Anthony Pennington. I attended an alternative high school after nearly failing out of my district. I soon began to blossom. I served as representative, treasurer, and president of student council. I served as Treasurer in our chapter of National Honor Society. I was in yearbook, and sang in chorus. I received the Suffolk County Executive Youth Achievement award. This award is bestowed upon students who have “demonstrated growth and personal achievement, overcome adversity or met challenges in a very extraordinary manner.”

I enrolled part-time at a community college after high school. It took me five years to graduate, as I did not qualify for financial aid for most of my academic career. I worked, sometimes over sixty hours a week, and took honors classes. Five days a week I would bike seven miles to work, and seven miles back. Yet, I found time to serve as an officer (executive officer of communications, executive officer of service, chapter president) in Phi Theta Kappa Honor Society. I served as president of Students for Peace and Social Justice, a student member of the school's re-accreditation committee, and a member of the Honors College. I volunteered a lot, and gave whatever I could give of myself to my campus community. I also interned at a social service agency where I counseled people facing emergencies such as homelessness, eviction, serious mental/physical illness, domestic violence, and more. I performed nearly double the required amount of hours needed for my degree. I was awarded the Student of the Year, and addressed my school at commencement (see the photo).

I transferred to Stony Brook University, where I earned my Bachelor of Social Work. I attended school full time, worked full time, and performed an internship for 16 hours a week. I interned at a subsidized senior housing complex where I provided counseling to people 62 and older. I was elected to the honor societies Golden Key as well as Alpha Sigma Lambda.

I took a year off of school to focus on my family. In August 2012, my wife and I welcomed our daughter into the world. Her name is Leela, and she is the greatest gift I have ever received. Unfortunately, my wife Lisa had some complications during delivery. For two hours I waited – not knowing anything – while my wife was attended to, and my daughter was taken to the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit. Leela also has had her share of medical issues that have required a lot of attention. All this stress was made 100x worse when my mother-in-law had a massive bleed in her brain, which sent her into a coma, followed by a long recovery process that is still occurring. I also faced a medical issue I prefer not to mention, but as a result I was out of work without pay for 6 months. I was also wrongly denied short-term disability through my employer based on a paperwork error on their end. This was difficult as I am the only one employed in our household. I have exhausted my savings, and put myself deep in debt. Every time I seem to get above the financial floodwater, I end up getting hit with another wave of debt.

…But I am focused on better things!

In September I will begin classes for my MSW degree, as well as an MBA in Healthcare Management. I will be interning a minimum of 21 hours a week, attending school, raising my daughter, and working. I also serve on the board of directors of a non-profit animal rights organization, and I am working on opening up a vegan soup kitchen.

I'm up for the challenge, but I need some help.

If you contribute to my campaign, you will be helping me graduate school. More than that, you will be helping me provide a good example for my daughter. You will help me get the training I need to help other people! I want to be a geriatric social worker, and would like to work with people/families of people who have dementia. One day it may be your grandparents or even you that I am helping!

This is an investment that will help many people!

story:
My daughter Emily has been offered a great opportunity to travel to Europe next summer with People to People as a student ambassador.  She has already passed the interview process, now she needs to raise the money.  The tuition for this educational experience of a lifetime is just over $7,000.  Over 19 days she will visit England, Scotland, Wales, and Ireland.  

To find out more about People to People and the opportunity she has been offered see below.

http://www.peopletopeople.com/find-a-trip/all-programs/europe/celtic-cultures

I am very proud of Emily for even being considered for this position as student ambassador.  I know this experience will have a positive impact on her for the rest of her life, as well as those around her.  I know that she will be a great representation of our country.  Thank you for your consideration.

story:
Friends and strangers, I need your help.

I am a college student studying Physics and European Studies. It is my ultimate dream to work at NASA someday. I currently write a science education blog at downhereonearth.wordpress.com. I've been getting some fabulous opportunities through that blog, but sadly I can't afford to take advantage of some of them them.

I've been given an opportunity.

I’m among 15 people who have just gotten selected to go to a NASA event at the Ames Research Center in California this Friday, the 26th. The event is essentially a test for some new rover robotics, along with some other lectures and networking. It’d be a great step for my career and my personal validation.

However, last-minute flights from Chicago to California are expensive - the event was announced last week, I was selected yesterday, I have to confirm my attendance in 2 days, and the event is in 6 days. Everything is very last-minute and so much more expensive.

Please help me grasp that opportunity.

I just spent all my expendable money going to a NASA event in Houston that I was also selected for (either I have excellent luck or the people at NASA like me – I’m pretty happy with those options). It was amazing - maybe even life-changing, and if you know me you know that I'm not prone to exaggeration. It was a big deal, and doing it again would be another big deal.

The only way I can get to this event in California is with some help paying for transportation - even the Greyhound bus is crazy expensive and takes several days, and the very cheapest flight I could find is $740 roundtrip. If I can raise $500, I can afford to go. If I can raise more than $600, I can afford to go and not stay in a sketchy motel. In the chance that I get any additional money past what the trip will cost, it would go towards other physics events where I can learn and network (like this one - I really want to go to that one). 

You would have my eternal gratitude, and would be helping an aspiring young woman in physics grow a career.

I wouldn’t ask, but I’m desperate. I’m a college student and I simply can’t afford to be spending that kind of money twice in two weeks – but I really really want to go to this event, and I feel it’s the next step towards realizing my dream.

Thank you.
